programme.title: Tonight with Target
programme.desc: The host casts a satirical eye over recent news stories. Co-host Remi Burgz goes out and about meeting some of the biggest names in music. There's also a visit to the realest hair salon in London for some hot and spicy takes on new and classic music videos from the salon's lively clientele.

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.sub-title: Wherever You Go, There You Are
programme.desc: Upon discovering that his family has moved on in his absence, Stede vows to make things right with his wife, Mary. After a desperate attempt to stage a show for the crew, Izzy confronts a depressed Blackbeard about his former life.

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Dave meets with music company executives while pitching for a record deal. He ends up being introduced to Benny Blanco and Justin Bieber, and gets invited to his first Hollywood party, where he rubs shoulders with Kourtney Kardashian..

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in London to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey helps the Viney family declutter their home after grandma Sue filled their house with her deceased mum's belongings and the contents of a recently closed gift shop. Sue's children are desperate for a clear out so they can come over and spend more time with her. The team remove everything from the house including 532 plastic carrier bags, 205 hair rollers, 30 umbrellas, 17 digital cameras and 443 pairs of shoes. While the family sort through what they want to keep, recycle, donate or sell, carpenter Rob installs a pulldown bed for extra space and Dilly reinstates the downstairs as a functioning living and dining space.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley shares the stories of a man who found religion and denounced violence, and hears about a cathedral helping people back into the workplace.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team face one of their smallest but trickiest challenges in the shape of mussels. These small shellfish have blocked the pipes of a huge vessel, stalling it in dock. Now it's up to the divers to blast the mussels out of their hiding places to allow the ship to sail once more.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and Ishy Khan go treasure hunting around Derbyshire. Izzie has her sights set on a little something for the breakfast table, while Ishy has some miniature sporting equipment in mind. Away from the shops, Izzie heads to Derby to see a huge collection of Victorian toys that were the home entertainment systems of the day, as well as being a novel form of advertising aimed at theatregoers. Ishy heads to Matlock Bath, just in time to take part in a festival of lights that took its inspiration from Queen Victoria.

programme.title: Winterwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham talks to David Attenborough about all things British wildlife and the series Wild Isles. Chris and Michaela Strachan also bid farewell to Wild Ken Hill, where they've been based for two years, while Iolo Williams and Gillian Burke remain on the coast for a cetacean celebration before saying goodbye to the wild badger sett they've been following all series.

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom..

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how Mediterranean cuisine and ingredients have influenced British culinary culture since it was first introduced by the Romans, and prepare their favourite recipes.

programme.title: Wild West: America's Great Frontier
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the history and geography of America's deserts, canyons and wilderness, exploring the lives of the people and animals that have found ways to thrive and prosper in these brutally inhospitable conditions. The first programme examines the agricultural traditions of the Hopi Native American tribe in northeastern Arizona, as well as exploring the strategies used by a variety of wildlife, including mustangs, coyotes and desert tortoises, to survive in these demanding environments.

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents more memorable moments from the long-running programme. Veteran experts discuss how they developed their sales patter, while jewellery specialist John Benjamin recalls a memorable visitor to the show in Belfast.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week.

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Presenters visit food festivals across the UK, beginning with Edith Bowman and Colin Murray at the Stranraer Oyster Festival, as celebrations mark the start of the native oyster season. They sail into Loch Ryan to Scotland's largest oyster bed to discover why they're so special. Chef Julie Lin discovers bargains in the World Food aisles, and gets the lowdown on low fat, semi-skimmed and full fat milk, while farmer Jim Smith gets stuck into some sticky sweets.

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox returns with the programme that celebrates the joy of books and reading, and is joined by guests Angela Scanlon, DJ Spoony, Rob Rinder and Cerys Matthews. They all bring their favourite books to champion, and review this week's book club choices of In the Blink of an Eye by Jo Callaghan, and Burial Rites by Hannah Kent.

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the first semi-final as he invites four heat-winners to brave the black chair once again to answer questions on the specialist subjects of The Great Escape, Oscar-winning performances of the 1990s, the life and death of stars, and Peep Show, before they are tested on their general knowledge.

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell asks the questions in the final of the quiz, with two teams battling it out to succeed last year's winners the Data Wizards and be named champions. The contestants must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may at first appear not to be linked, with one set of clues asking what concludes the sequence nauru, Canada, BOlivia.

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the third of the quarter-finals, two teams of four students compete to make it to the next stage of the competition as they try to win two matches and progress to the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: Facing the board in this edition are Ruben, who has been serving a sentence for biting a man's ear off, and Tom , who made close to a million pounds dealing cocaine. Mark disagrees with his sentence for threatening to kill and denies large portions of the crime that led him to prison. Will his desire to see his kids for Christmas be enough to convince the Board he deserves a second chance, or will his chequered past continue to dictate his future?.

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Andy has a job interview and Lance has a lot of catching up to do, so the mystery of the buried bomber is the least of their problems. But then a disturbing possibility emerges from an unlikely source, throwing everything into doubt. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather.

programme.title: Don't Look Now (1973)
programme.desc: A couple trying to get over the death of their daughter take a trip to Venice, where they are shocked by a psychic's claim that the child is trying to contact them. Although the wife believes her story, the husband remains sceptical - until he begins to be troubled by spectral visions of his own. Nicholas Roeg's supernatural thriller based on Daphne du Maurier's short story, with Donald Sutherland and Julie Christie.

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: Facing the board in this edition are Ruben, who has been serving a sentence for biting a man's ear off, and Tom , who made close to a million pounds dealing cocaine. Mark disagrees with his sentence for threatening to kill and denies large portions of the crime that led him to prison. Will his desire to see his kids for Christmas be enough to convince the Board he deserves a second chance, or will his chequered past continue to dictate his future?.

programme.title: Ar Scáth an Cheoil
programme.desc: Traditional and folk music show, combining archive material recorded over the past 50 years with chat and performances from leading artists from across Ireland and beyond. In the first programme, Zoe Conway and Jim McKillop join forces on fiddles, Neil Martin chats about his friendship and musical connection with Eithne Ní Uallacháin and Gerry O' Connor. Plus, a collaboration and chat between Liam Ó Maonlaí and Megan Nic Ruairí, and Edel Ní Churraoin celebrates the music of Galway melodeon player Johnny Connolly. In Irish.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather.

programme.title: Don't Look Now (1973)
programme.desc: A couple trying to get over the death of their daughter take a trip to Venice, where they are shocked by a psychic's claim that the child is trying to contact them. Although the wife believes her story, the husband remains sceptical - until he begins to be troubled by spectral visions of his own. Nicholas Roeg's supernatural thriller based on Daphne du Maurier's short story, with Donald Sutherland and Julie Christie.

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.sub-title: Wherever You Go, There You Are
programme.desc: Upon discovering that his family has moved on in his absence, Stede vows to make things right with his wife, Mary. After a desperate attempt to stage a show for the crew, Izzy confronts a depressed Blackbeard about his former life.

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Dave meets with music company executives while pitching for a record deal. He ends up being introduced to Benny Blanco and Justin Bieber, and gets invited to his first Hollywood party, where he rubs shoulders with Kourtney Kardashian..

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in London to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey helps the Viney family declutter their home after grandma Sue filled their house with her deceased mum's belongings and the contents of a recently closed gift shop. Sue's children are desperate for a clear out so they can come over and spend more time with her. The team remove everything from the house including 532 plastic carrier bags, 205 hair rollers, 30 umbrellas, 17 digital cameras and 443 pairs of shoes. While the family sort through what they want to keep, recycle, donate or sell, carpenter Rob installs a pulldown bed for extra space and Dilly reinstates the downstairs as a functioning living and dining space.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley shares the stories of a man who found religion and denounced violence, and hears about a cathedral helping people back into the workplace.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team face one of their smallest but trickiest challenges in the shape of mussels. These small shellfish have blocked the pipes of a huge vessel, stalling it in dock. Now it's up to the divers to blast the mussels out of their hiding places to allow the ship to sail once more.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and Ishy Khan go treasure hunting around Derbyshire. Izzie has her sights set on a little something for the breakfast table, while Ishy has some miniature sporting equipment in mind. Away from the shops, Izzie heads to Derby to see a huge collection of Victorian toys that were the home entertainment systems of the day, as well as being a novel form of advertising aimed at theatregoers. Ishy heads to Matlock Bath, just in time to take part in a festival of lights that took its inspiration from Queen Victoria.

programme.title: Winterwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham talks to David Attenborough about all things British wildlife and the series Wild Isles. Chris and Michaela Strachan also bid farewell to Wild Ken Hill, where they've been based for two years, while Iolo Williams and Gillian Burke remain on the coast for a cetacean celebration before saying goodbye to the wild badger sett they've been following all series.

programme.title: First Edition
programme.desc: TalkTV's flagship evening news programme takes an energetic look at tomorrow's news, tonight, through the lens of the newspaper first editions..

programme.title: Piers Morgan Uncensored
programme.desc: The host presents his unmissable verdict on the day's global events with an hour of fearless debate, straight-talking interviews with the world's leading figures, and plenty of fun.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: The Nightcrawler and the Beast in the Tree
programme.desc: The team looks into a new sighting of Sasquatch in the trees of California. Plus, a man claims to have captured footage of the infamous Fresno Nightcrawlers in his back yard and mysterious streaks are witnessed in the night sky in Australia.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: An unidentified creature washed up on the beach, while a strange object is seen over the skies of inner Mongolia. Tony Harris and his team of experts examine new videos and photographs to reach a verdict on what lies behind strange happenings.

programme.title: Believers: Extreme Hauntings
programme.desc: A wrecking yard owner discovers a ghost captured on CCTV, a retired schoolteacher's wife is attacked by a ghost, and a woman's son records the voice of an evil spirit.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les's anger over Seth and Ashley's sibling rivalry boils over to the point that he gives them an ultimatum to calm down or be sacked - but they carry on bickering.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les remains in hospital following his collapse, and Seth and Ashley continue manning operations at the pawn shop. However, the bickering continues.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: The spotlight is on the judges as one comes to blows with an attorney, and another is leapt at by a defendant. A murder suspect makes a plea to the victim's family.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A man suspected of killing his five children faces their mother, while another meets his baby son for the first time. A defendant has a nasty reaction to his sentencing.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in the courtroom when a gun ends up in the wrong hands. Meanwhile, a defendant turns on his attorney in a brutal attack, and someone bares all for the judge.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A judge is threatened by a murder suspect. Meanwhile, there's a savage attack in the courtroom when two sons see red as their mother's killer is sentenced.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has big plans for a little street rocket known as a Manta, and the crew commissions an '80s-era Corvette that the owner wants to bring into the new millennium. Shannon meets a motorcycle racer who wants her Harley XR1200 customised to her exact specifications.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold begins to fall, and the staff worry that they could end up losing money. Les, Seth and Ashley become more conscious of what items they buy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les offers to buy a diamond-encrusted watch from a customer. He makes sure his jewellery expert takes a close look, having been stung by a similar deal previously.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold continues to drop. Seth suggests they should review their purchases, and sort out the cluttered sales floor, along with a warehouse overloaded with junk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is angered when Les dismisses the consultant's suggestions about improving business practices. Seth disappears, and his manager fears he may be on the verge of quitting.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: The world is full of strange and mysterious weather phenomenon that there is still no explanation for. The presenter wonders whether such events are a consequence of simple scientific anomalies, or whether there are stranger, more spiritual forces at work.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Tattoos, piercings and body modifications are big business. This edition considers whether man's desire for these alterations stem from a profound link to his ancestors.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In 2019, millions of people responded to an internet post advocating to storm the gates of Area 51, the world's most top-secret military installation. However, the US military vowed to defend the base with deadly force.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy's paltry gifts are no match for Cindy's foul mood at an auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Out in Hesperia, Mary's transportation troubles lead to teaming up with Kenny and taking him out to pasture. Darrell shows the next generation of Gambler how it's done, while the Vegas Ladies' mid-century style lets them write their own ticket.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Tempers flare when recently separated Brandi and Jarrod find themselves at the same auction - she gets the Laura treatment and he regresses to his childhood self. Ivy schools Ivy Jr, who needs to find his footing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a collection of James Bond movie trading cards, while a seller brings in an old Chinese bell. Later, Chum and Antwaun set sail on a trip to Lake Tahoe to check out a vintage sailboat. Will the sail withstand the perils of negotiation or sink to the depths of no return?.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.sub-title: Buddy, Can You Spare a Thousand?
programme.desc: Rick considers buying a rare $1,000 banknote - and is willing to spend $10,000 to get his hands on it.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rap artist Flavor Flav brings in an OJ Simpson statue and is asking for six-figures, but it remains to be seen whether he will get what he wants.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les confronts Seth after finding out that he was at Bill's pawn shop. He asks some blunt questions about why he would betray the family by visiting a rival store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: On the last day of the Dream Cruise, Les buys what is claimed to be the world's largest fishing lure - reportedly an art piece saluting Michigan - for $3,000

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley smells cannabis smoke in the warehouse and tries to find the culprit, while Les puts out a cash reward for information.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has the opportunity to get his hands on truck loads of brand new goods that could change the store for ever.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Chile has the highest number of UFO sightings of anywhere on Earth. Here, incredible footage of a strange craft has people asking again about the reasons why.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Stone Giants
programme.desc: From Egypt to Easter Island, towering figures built by ancient man stand watch over Earth - but do they depict visitors from another world?.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have insisted that simple stones can do everything from choosing a king to causing death. The actor-presenter considers what it is about rocks and stones that inspires some people to worship them.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The King of Montebello cannot wait to see what he can drum up this time around. Rene sniffs out a great locker, stepping over the competition to get it. Kenny does his best to fire up his profits, while Brandi can't see the potential in the units.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura are on the hunt for better units and better buyers. Rene tries to capitalise on warehouse sales and nabs a deal..

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public in Tatton Park, Cheshire, sort the treasures from their trash. Items include a collection of crockery, jewellery and ornaments, which ensure the dealers get their cash out to tempt the sellers. Plus, a selection of Coronation Street autographs shows up on James Layte's table.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The Laginas and team reflect on more than a decade of work as they find themselves closer than ever to recovering the treasure.

programme.title: CBBC Live Lessons
programme.desc: Rhys Stephenson and Maddie Moate take over the Science Museum in London, with an out of this world forces Live Lesson for British Science Week! Our very own Live Lesson astronaut Frankie is stuck out in space after completing a mission to the moon, and needs the help of 7-11 year-olds everywhere to come back down to Earth. With help from a team of mission controllers, Rhys, Maddie and pupils watching need to use their knowledge of forces and explore gravity, friction and air resistance to design a landing module to bring our intrepid explorer safely back home. Along the way, we hear from real-life astronauts including Dr Helen Sharman, the first British astronaut in space and American astronaut Bob Hines who has recently returned from a NASA space mission..

programme.title: Out of This World
programme.desc: Dr Maggie uncovers the people and the missions that are tasked with looking for aliens in space and asks whether life really is out there and how will we find out. Dr Maggie’s star guest Sofia Sheikh is searching for intelligent life in the universe, while Maggie answers all your space questions. Her Top 5 is of the places where we might find extraterrestrial life. Buckle up, it’s time to go Out Of This World!.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: There's a new sheriff in town when Mike attempts to stop the raccoons from using Tom's train set to ship their loot back to their den..

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Bumbling detective Inspector Gadget battles the forces of M.A.D. with the aid of his gadgets and gizmos, his niece Penny and her intrepid dog, Brain.

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Bumbling detective Inspector Gadget battles the forces of M.A.D. with the aid of his gadgets and gizmos, his niece Penny and her intrepid dog, Brain.

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Zoe is having slumber parties at everyone's houses and giving them grades - if she has fun, you get the 'approved by Zoe' label, but if it doesn't work out, it's the humiliation of the century for you... JP has everything ready to make Zoe happy and impress her - dinner, decorations, activities, but Zoe has decided that her next pyjama party will be at Pedro's instead... so it's tough luck for JP, then!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz discovers the hidden dimension where lost socks go. He invents a machine to bring them back, but when they appear, they take on a life of their own and escape the Fizzlab. Magoo thinks he's witnessing an invasion of mutant caterpillars..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When a crab spider parachutes into his life, Lloyd calls her Crabbie Spindles and decides to raise her as a vegetarian and single-handedly change fly-spider relationships forever! However, it becomes clear that Lloyd's bitten off more than he can chew....

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. There is an exciting new Ghost Coaster inside the sofa, but Lloyd, PB and Abacus are too short to go on it - however, Lloyd refuses to allow his height to get in the way of fun, and so he devises a way to make the three of them appear tall enough to ride it..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave's first plane journey doesn't go to plan when the air pressure and the need to go to the toilet makes his head swell..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Instructed to keep an eye on Gran while the rest of the Spuds visit to the doctor, Dave finds that she has escaped.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: The Legend of the Gold Microphone!
programme.desc: Scooby and Shaggy meet up with their biker buddy, Axl Rose, on a tour of famous roadside diners along iconic Route 66. The diner they're heading for is famous for its varieties of delicious pies. But soon, they all find themselves embroiled in a crazy mystery involving spooky mudmen, the lost ruins of an ancient civilization and a treasure of Spanish gold.

programme.title: Buck and Buddy
programme.desc: Roger the Roach shows up one morning wearing a gigantic wig, acting like he's always had the flowing locks of a post-apocalyptic Adonis..

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: When Scooby and the gang are investigating one of the most haunted mansions in the historic Hollywood Hills they meet up with none-other than famous actor George Takei. His house is next door and he's hoping to save this abandoned old mansion as a historic landmark. As an old suit of armor comes alive and chases them all over the spooky estate the gang and Mr. Takei discover the mansion is not as abandoned as everyone thought..

programme.title: Tata and Kuma
programme.desc: Madcap animated comedy. Awakened from a long sleep, Chenpong reveals himself to the Room 1004 family - he recognises Tata and Kuma as intruders and attacks them with a kung fu technique, but with zero impact and leaving Tata and Kuma both dumbfounded..

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Adventures of Robin, Cyborg, Starfire, Raven and Beast Boy. They are superheroes who save the day, but what happens when they're not fighting crime?.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.sub-title: The Ice Pop Trio Creek Street
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows 10-year-old Craig Williams and his two friends, Kelsey and John Paul, as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek which acts as a utopia where children reign.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows 10-year-old Craig Williams and his two friends, Kelsey and John Paul, as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek which acts as a utopia where children reign.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Tired of Monkey King's teachings, MK meets a mysterious and powerful figure called the Six-Eared Macaque - the Macaque offers to train MK and MK accepts as he hopes to learn more so he can defend the city. However, what MK doesn't know is that his new teacher is actually an old enemy of the Monkey King... and is trying to siphon his powers from MK in order to defeat his fabled arch-nemesis..

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. When MK discovers that the Demon Bull King has taken over the city, he must use everything that he's learned to defeat him, so he teams up with Red Son and Princess Iron Fan to kick DBK back into reality..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. Virgil and Grandma scramble to rescue a crane operator after an anti-technology group powers up an electromagnetic device in central London. Updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, with the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak, Thomas Brodie-Sangster and David Graham.

programme.title: Overlord and the Underwoods
programme.desc: Willow starts dating. Overlord doesn't think this boy is good enough for his cousin. Weaver thinks Bebe has a crush on him. Flower deals with a rocky day of her own.

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird
programme.desc: Comedy drama following the adventures of an Australian family who move to an isolated seaside village in western Ireland, with the parents having a secret to hide.

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: A comedy arts and crafts show for six to 11-year-olds and presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bec can never go away, so she's bringing her holiday to the Takeaway! She comes up with a Takeaway technique that's bound to lift anyone's spirits, and she gets a call from a customer who's in need of rocking out - Bec also creates a ravenous game with just three ingredients, and she delivers a surprise to a riding instructor that's nothing to sniff about!.

programme.title: Ted's Top Ten
programme.sub-title: Ways To Lose At Home Alone
programme.desc: Comedy series following the misadventures of Ted and his school friends and family. Stu and Lani are taking Bodhi to a holiday camp for the weekend in an attempt to bond with her and bring some much-needed sunshine into her life - with them out of the way, Ted can bring some much-needed freedom into his own life as he, Jai and Cody now have the house to themselves. They are soon faced with three problems, though, the most difficult being how to corral unruly Airbnb guests who've come to stay....

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Ludicrous Lunacy of the Laserlightmare
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. When George and Harold learn about Krupp's plan to get re-hired as camp director next summer, they reform the M.I.S.F.A.R.T.S. in order to stop him, but Krupp discovers their plan and locks down the camp with a state-of-the-art laser security system called Laserlightmare - now the team has to break out and stop Krupp....

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is elected Eco-Friendly Officer at school for her Recycling Old Toys programme, but when it comes to recycling the old dolls she adored when she was a tiny tot, Sam has pangs of regret. She thinks that she can repair them with a little bit of effort - to spare them, she therefore asks for the power to give new life to broken and damaged objects. However, instead of 'repairing' the dolls, the half-power endows them with life... and the dolls run away..

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is thrilled when the students are asked to prepare a presentation on the solar system, but her enthusiasm is dampened when Amber suggests that they do the report together because she's so annoying. To avoid being partners with Amber, Sam tells her that she'd rather work alone, but when a rumour spreads that Amber is planning something totally rad, Sam is overcome with curiosity and pride - she has to find out more about it somehow, but she can't let Amber know..

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Driving outside Shreveport, Louisiana, our gang of mystery solvers is run off the road by a shooting star that crashes down in the middle of the large ranch belonging to none-other than famous football hall of famer and TV sports host, Terry Bradshaw. Upon further investigation, the 'shooting star' turns out to be a spaceship unleashing an alien monster on the local countryside! The gang and Mr. Bradshaw work together to get to the bottom of this space alien mystery and figure out what this alien is really after - championship rings or giant doughnuts.

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. There's a sports championship at the local stadium - the competition is the kids' chance to win a medal. If they do, they could be as popular as top athlete Flavio Tamaley, but it's been ages since they've done any sports - however, the championship is a competition for babies... but as there are no age limits in the rules, our intrepid trio decide to join in and to try to win every event on offer..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. In order to be as popular as Santa Claus, Fizz leaves presents on everyone's doorsteps. But Magoo has launched Operation Clean Streets and throws away Fizz's presents, thinking he's cleaning up..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. As an anniversary treat, Gena has booked a private performance by Dolichovsky, Malcolm's favourite actor - Lloyd is entrusted with preparing the apple for the snail's arrival, but Dolichovsky proves to be far more demanding than expected..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. After his inattention causes a mid-flight collision with Polly, Lloyd must attend a 'flight awareness' course run by Molly - if he refuses, he risks being grounded and will therefore have to walk everywhere!.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Gran sits in front of the television for so long that she turns into a cocoon, and with a little help from Dave - who wants his favourite seat back - she hatches into a moth. When Moth-Gran sets her sights on the moon, it's up to the Spuds to find a way to entice her back..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave and his friend Zombie Katie are working on a school project together about endangered animals, so George takes them on an expedition to the local park to see what they can find. There they discover the much-fabled Beast of Grimsby - and Dave must decide between a gold star at school and the future of the beast..

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Our Shaggy is a bit of a Beatnik poet (but only when no one is around) and Scooby is so proud that he enters Shaggy into a poetry slam contest in Central Park. But when Shaggy finds out he's going up against famous singer-songwriter Halsey he just about freaks. He freaks even more when the poetry slam is attacked by a horrible gator-man-monster from the NYC sewers below!.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago

programme.title: Overlord and the Underwoods
programme.desc: Overlord helps Weaver with morning announcements and uses the opportunity to hypnotize the adults at school. Jim drags Willow to 'Bring Your Daughter to Work Day'.

programme.title: Dodo
programme.desc: Wickedly sharp animated series following a boy navigating the dramas and pitfalls of Year 7 and trying to fit in. It's Joe Connolly's first day at secondary school and he's looking forward to it - he has his best friend Frisbo by his side, and together they can conquer anything. However, things start to go wrong when they're in different classes for biology, Joe bends down to pick up his bag and rips his trousers, and Frisbo makes a new best friend called Pete. Will the mates split up for good?.

programme.title: Dodo
programme.desc: Wickedly sharp animated series following a boy navigating the dramas and pitfalls of Year 7 and trying to fit in. programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in Redondo Beach, California, for the first of two visits to Zayna Flaming Grill, a Mediterranean restaurant owned and run by aunt and niece Faye and Brenda. Faye believes she has the weight of the entire restaurant on her shoulders, while Brenda feels she isn't treated as an equal in the business. With tensions rising, the food not up to scratch and everyone playing the blame game, the chef is faced with one of the trickiest situations he's ever encountered.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Swansea, performing arts director Anthony plans a theatre-themed menu for his guests, Ross, Tula, Kola and Julie. Anthony's plans go awry in the kitchen, threatening to earn him more rotten earn tomatoes than rave reviews.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Salesman Ross hosts the second party from Swansea, but his guests make a discovery that leaves him with some explaining to do, while tension erupts between him and Kola.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Triathlete Tula serves a Spanish-themed menu in Swansea, hoping charm and chorizo can smooth over the dispute between Ross and Julie and avoid a punch-up over the paella.

programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie fail to make a good impression on a professional couple who move in next door, while Arthur takes advantage of Spencer's job. With Leah Remini and Kevin James.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin makes friends with reclusive author TH Houghton, to the considerable dismay of Niles and Frasier, who are frustrated that their own attempts to strike up an acquaintance have failed dismally. programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles hits the airwaves as a stand-in during Frasier's absence from his radio show, but gets more than he bargained for thanks to a star basketball player. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne is dumped by her boyfriend and causes bemusement in the Crane household by immediately embarking on a new relationship - with a man who looks, dresses, talks and acts exactly like Niles. Comedy, starring Jane Leeves and David Hyde Pierce.

programme.desc: Steph McGovern presents the weekday magazine, including celebrity guests, food ideas, real-life features and entertainment, lifestyle and consumer stories. Plus, a sideways look at the news in One O'Clock Views.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Pat Nevin is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.

programme.title: Tool Club
programme.desc: DIY show hosted by Kevin Duala, giving viewers the chance to learn skills and gain the confidence to tackle any home-improvement challenges themselves. This week, the team are in Preston, helping a residential community rescue their much-loved allotment.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In France, a couple start an alpaca farm while in Spain, two friends build a padel tennis court and a couple from Yorkshire try to open a rock 'n' roll-themed B&B.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Political Slot
programme.desc: Helen Morgan MP discusses the Liberal Democrat view on issues faced in rural communities such as north Shropshire.

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie shares clever ways to make meat stretch further, preparing meatball kebabs on a bed of creamy lentils and rice, and crispy pork noodles with sticky ginger and garlic, making super-speedy homemade noodles from just flour and water. Plus, Karan Gokani shares some tips on Sri Lankan cooking that can deliver takeaway flavours without takeaway prices.

programme.title: Paula
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part profile of Paula Yates, featuring never-before-heard audio interviews she recorded after the death of her partner Michael Hutchence in 1997. Part one focuses on Paula's rise to fame, her groundbreaking appearances on The Tube and the huge fame she and husband Bob Geldof experienced after the success of global charity Live Aid. With contributions from Terence Trent D'Arby, Robbie Williams, Nicky Clarke and Vanessa Feltz.

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: The presenter finds out about mixing sex and eroticism with food and weight gain, meeting two British mothers who have built a following from fetish videos. In Florida, Alice meets two leaders in the fat-fetish porn world, breaking boundaries on their mission to fly the flag for feedism.

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc: Vogue Williams meets porn star, Skyler who believes bigger buttocks could boost her career and beauty therapist, Bianca who wants to bring her boobs under control. But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them and hear from our feedback panel?.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Becky, a 22-year-old from Bristol, seeks a man who will accept her and her snake. It remains to be seen whether leather-clad Lee from London will prove to be the open-minded guy she's looking for. Paul, a 54-year-old lorry driver from Newcastle, is looking for a woman who appreciates his softer side. He is paired with three-time divorced Ruth - who it turns out is his brother's ex. Plus, primary school assistant teacher Michael struggles to control his nerves for his date with student Imogen.

programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Pat Nevin is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.

programme.title: Tool Club
programme.desc: DIY show hosted by Kevin Duala, giving viewers the chance to learn skills and gain the confidence to tackle any home-improvement challenges themselves. This week, the team are in Preston, helping a residential community rescue their much-loved allotment.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In France, a couple start an alpaca farm while in Spain, two friends build a padel tennis court and a couple from Yorkshire try to open a rock 'n' roll-themed B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first destination of the week is Fountain Cottage in Bellingham, Northumberland. The hosts are hoping their award-winning cafe will give them the edge.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Travel-loving credit controller Dannica hosts the first of five dinner parties from Huddersfield, treating her guests to a culinary round-the-world tour, from Italy to Mexico.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns sets out to be reunited with his beloved teddy bear, which he lost as a child. Unfortunately, it is now owned by Maggie, presenting Homer with an unenviable dilemma. Featuring the voices of the Ramones.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.

programme.title: The Political Slot
programme.desc: Helen Morgan MP discusses the Liberal Democrat view on issues faced in rural communities such as north Shropshire.

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie shares clever ways to make meat stretch further, preparing meatball kebabs on a bed of creamy lentils and rice, and crispy pork noodles with sticky ginger and garlic, making super-speedy homemade noodles from just flour and water. Plus, Karan Gokani shares some tips on Sri Lankan cooking that can deliver takeaway flavours without takeaway prices.

programme.title: Paula
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part profile of Paula Yates, featuring never-before-heard audio interviews she recorded after the death of her partner Michael Hutchence in 1997. Part one focuses on Paula's rise to fame, her groundbreaking appearances on The Tube and the huge fame she and husband Bob Geldof experienced after the success of global charity Live Aid. With contributions from Terence Trent D'Arby, Robbie Williams, Nicky Clarke and Vanessa Feltz.

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: The presenter finds out about mixing sex and eroticism with food and weight gain, meeting two British mothers who have built a following from fetish videos. In Florida, Alice meets two leaders in the fat-fetish porn world, breaking boundaries on their mission to fly the flag for feedism.

programme.title: Inspector Ricciardi
programme.desc: Italian supernatural crime drama, set in 1930s Naples. Aloof detective Ricciardi has inherited a curse from his mother, that allows him to see the ghosts of people who have died violently and hear their final thoughts. When a famous singer is found dead in his dressing room, Ricciardi senses foul play in the victim's last words. In Italian.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in Redondo Beach, California, for the first of two visits to Zayna Flaming Grill, a Mediterranean restaurant owned and run by aunt and niece Faye and Brenda. Faye believes she has the weight of the entire restaurant on her shoulders, while Brenda feels she isn't treated as an equal in the business. With tensions rising, the food not up to scratch and everyone playing the blame game, the chef is faced with one of the trickiest situations he's ever encountered.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Swansea, performing arts director Anthony plans a theatre-themed menu for his guests, Ross, Tula, Kola and Julie. However, straight-talking Tula tries to steal the show with a candid revelation and Julie brings the house down with some frisky fun at Kola's expense. Anthony's plans go awry in the kitchen, threatening to earn him more rotten earn tomatoes than rave reviews.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Salesman Ross hosts the second party from Swansea, but his guests make a discovery that leaves him with some explaining to do, while tension erupts between him and Kola.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Social carer Kola provides plenty of hip-hop swagger on the third day of the contest in Swansea, with a Nigerian menu he hopes will both educate and impress his fellow diners.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Triathlete Tula serves a Spanish-themed menu in Swansea, hoping charm and chorizo can smooth over the dispute between Ross and Julie and avoid a punch-up over the paella.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Social worker Julie plans a chilled out slumber party for the final night of the week in Swansea. She cooks a homely menu, but struggles with the pronunciation as well as the preparation of some of her ingredients. At the end of another eventful evening, the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting in Hertfordshire, with Phil searching for properties for Rich and Bethan, who have lost out on two homes already. Meanwhile, Kirstie helps Chicago-born Lauren and her husband Paul come to terms with the smaller scale of British properties.

programme.title: Countdown

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dick discovers that Mary has been receiving elaborate love letters from a mystery man named Scoochie, while the Solomons are disgusted when they lose their category at the Alien Awards Show. Comedy, guest starring John Cleese.

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dick battles Dr Liam Neesam for Mary's affections, only to discover his enemy may have more sinister motives - which involve turning Earth into a giant theme park called Planet Monkeyworld. John Cleese guest stars.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie and Doug book an appointment for Arthur to see a psychotherapist but soon find they are the ones needing treatment as they try to sort their problems out. Comedy, guest starring William Hurt and Ben Stiller.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug starts to get lonely when Carrie has to work nights, but soon discovers that Arthur is the ideal person to keep him company. Comedy, starring Kevin James and Jerry Stiller.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie fail to make a good impression on a professional couple who move in next door, while Arthur takes advantage of Spencer's job. With Leah Remini and Kevin James.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin makes friends with reclusive author TH Houghton, to the considerable dismay of Niles and Frasier, who are frustrated that their own attempts to strike up an acquaintance have failed dismally. Comedy, guest starring Robert Prosky (Hill Street Blues), with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles hits the airwaves as a stand-in during Frasier's absence from his radio show, but gets more than he bargained for thanks to a star basketball player. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne is dumped by her boyfriend and causes bemusement in the Crane household by immediately embarking on a new relationship - with a man who looks, dresses, talks and acts exactly like Niles. Comedy, starring Jane Leeves and David Hyde Pierce.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Lowell Hawthorne, President and CEO of Caribbean food producers Golden Krust, dons a disguise to go undercover among the workforce in his own company. Lowell has ambitious plans for expansion and takes the opportunity to work alongside a cashier, two chefs and a forklift operator to determine the state of the business.

programme.title: The Gypsies Next Door
programme.desc: Documentary following travellers' constant struggle to co-exist with settled communities. Carol and her family cannot understand why her community is so hated and vilified, while local man Arthur is on a mission to understand what brings the travellers into parks and public areas - and Carol's caravan is his first stop. Johnny and his family live in a chalet in Essex but his non-traveller wife Andrea has had enough of feeling ostracised and wants to move back into a normal house.

programme.title: The Gypsies Next Door
programme.desc: In the Irish town of Thurles, the council want Barry to move into new housing purpose-built for travellers. But they will not allow him to take his 30 horses. Teenager Scarlett, who lives with her traveller family in Luton, dreams of being a successful model - and non-traveller model Danielle Mason is going to help show her the way.

programme.title: World's Busiest Train Stations
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at Flinders Street station in Melbourne, which is not just the busiest and oldest in Australia, but in the whole of the southern hemisphere. programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: The doctors treat a number of patients who have already sought help for their problems online. Depression sufferer Tina returns to the surgery for advice from Dr Wyne.

programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell narrates a look at how the nation's roads are policed, joining Cheshire's elite team of motorway officers as they crack down on Britain's worst drivers. In the opening edition, Amy Hollis is on the hunt for a drunk driver who has been on a late-night wrecking spree through the streets of Chester, leaving a trail of damage to parked cars.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A busy bank holiday weekend for North Yorkshire's officers sees a day trip to Scarborough turn into a high-speed pursuit, and for two young women caught up in the chase, it's an unexpected nightmare. A desperate suspect on a potentially stolen motorbike puts lives at risk when a passenger falls off as police close in for a stop. On the outskirts of York, a suspected drink-driver crashes at speed into multiple vehicles, while a young driver appears to be in denial when he blows almost twice the drink drive limit at the roadside and asks officers to call his mum to prove he doesn't drink alcohol.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: A flood of patients with Covid-19 puts staff in the A&E department of Barnsley Hospital under pressure, with every arrival needing swabbing making waiting times even longer. Fifty-year-old Richard has been rushed in with severe burns across one side of his body, while 64-year-old Jan is in resus after his smart watch sounded the alarm when his heart rate dropped to a dangerously low level.

programme.title: 999: Emergency Call Out
programme.desc: Paramedic Ayshe and special sergeant Hannah respond to two calls - a car that has crashed into a wall and ended up on its roof and a heated argument in a convenience store.

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Damion has sustained numerous traumatic injuries after being trapped upside down in his car following a crash. Despite numerous injuries to the head and chest, Trauma Team Leader Dr Chris Pickering is most worried about Damion's lungs as his patient struggles to breathe.

programme.title: Britain's Favourite 90s Hits
programme.desc: Chart countdown celebrating the biggest-selling singles of the 1990s, as well as the most memorable pop videos, the artists who appeared in them and the stories behind the songs. Boyzone's Shane Lynch, Blur's Alex James, Peter Andre, and Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans share their views of the biggest hits, while Hannah Spearritt from S Club 7 reminisces about her time at the top of the charts and Cliff Richard talks about his big hit Millennium Prayer..

programme.desc: In the Irish town of Thurles, the council want Barry to move into new housing purpose-built for travellers. But they will not allow him to take his 30 horses. Teenager Scarlett, who lives with her traveller family in Luton, dreams of being a successful model - and non-traveller model Danielle Mason is going to help show her the way.

programme.title: World's Busiest Train Stations
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at Flinders Street station in Melbourne, which is not just the busiest and oldest in Australia, but in the whole of the southern hemisphere. The start of the Australian Open tennis tournament means that many more passengers than usual are expected, while the control room braces itself for even more trouble after trespassers are spotted walking on a busy line.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family visit the school fete, where the top prize in the raffle is a trip in a hot-air balloon.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy and Daddy Pig plan a party for George's birthday.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Suzy Sheep has come to play with Peppa and has made up a pretend friend called Leo Lion.

programme.title: Blue's Clues & You
programme.sub-title: A Blue's Clues Festival of Lights
programme.desc: Everyone is at Periwinkle's house celebrating Hanukkah.

programme.title: Oggy Oggy
programme.desc: Oggy Oggy and Sporty have fun tobogganing on the rainbow and break it into several pieces. Then they realise that a piece is missing.

programme.title: Odo
programme.desc: Bud and Louie turn out to be geniuses at leaf spotting, so Odo wants to become as good as they are.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Pontypandy is flooded by a high tide and Norman goes out in a boat to save Woolly and her lamb.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends: All Engines Go!
programme.desc: Thomas carries a famous musician across Sodor, and in the process, gains a new appreciation for being his normal engine-self.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: A TV crew shows up to film rescues on Kangaroo Beach, and Frizzy performs a rip-roaring opera at sea in an elaborate costume.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go sailing with Grandpa Pig, but he keeps getting the boat stuck in the mud. They all decide to have a sleepover on the boat while they wait for the tide to come back in.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The children are all having fun growing different plants and playing hide and seek in the wild wood.

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Halloween arrives in Adventure Bay - but a mysterious kid in a giant spider costume is taking all the treats from the trick-or-treaters.

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: The friends have fun with a balloon.

programme.title: The Adventures of Paddington
programme.sub-title: Paddington Plays the Floor is Lava
programme.desc: The Browns take part in a very competitive game of the Floor Is Lava.

programme.title: Milo
programme.desc: Lofty, MIlo and Lark go on a botanical adventure to discover the rarest plant of all.

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Mayor Goodway is left in charge of a class pet, but the hamster escapes.

programme.title: Daisy & Ollie
programme.desc: Daddy finds an old surfboard in the garage and the children are keen to learn how to surf - even in the garden paddling pool.

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: A new game has King Posy telling her subject Pip what to do. However, when the power goes to her head, Pip decides not to play any more. Posy finds a way to make up for her bossiness so they can get back to having fun.

programme.title: Milkshake! Storytime & Sign
programme.desc: Kiera-Nicole Brennan reads a children's book, accompanied by British Sign Language expert, visual storyteller and signer Aimee Campbell.

programme.title: Sunny Bunnies
programme.desc: Big Boo wins a hazelnut in a test of strength at the funfair, but cannot break it open.

programme.title: Jeremy Vine
programme.desc: The broadcaster and guests discuss the issues of the day, with co-host Storm Huntley joining him for phone-ins and reading out viewers' correspondence.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: The doctors treat a number of patients who have already sought help for their problems online. A health app has recommended that Maryam, who is experiencing dizzy spells and bloating, should be screened for irritable bowel syndrome, while Paul says that Google has told him his sleeping difficulties and loud snoring are caused by sleep apnoea. Depression sufferer Tina returns to the surgery for advice from Dr Wyne.

programme.title: 5 News at Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Cash operates outside the law as he sets out on a mission to avenge Eden, while Bree keeps Remi at arm's length and Gabe gives Mackenzie a cheque.

programme.title: Hidden Family Secrets (2021)
programme.desc: A woman uncovers her own mother's sinister secret when she endeavours to save her dying daughter. Thriller, starring Alex Paxton-Beesley and Madelyn Keys.

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Following expat Keith and his family, who run a busy butcher's shop catering to Brits in a picturesque village near the holiday hotspot of Alicante.

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.sub-title: Big Road Rescue: Emergency Call Out
programme.desc: A huge 32-ton tipper truck has slid down a dirt embankment and is lying on its side, and a lorry stuck in reverse severely blocking traffic in Leicester city centre.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell narrates a look at how the nation's roads are policed, joining Cheshire's elite team of motorway officers as they crack down on Britain's worst drivers. In the opening edition, Amy Hollis is on the hunt for a drunk driver who has been on a late-night wrecking spree through the streets of Chester, leaving a trail of damage to parked cars.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A busy bank holiday weekend for North Yorkshire's officers sees a day trip to Scarborough turn into a high-speed pursuit, and for two young women caught up in the chase, it's an unexpected nightmare. A desperate suspect on a potentially stolen motorbike puts lives at risk when a passenger falls off as police close in for a stop. On the outskirts of York, a suspected drink-driver crashes at speed into multiple vehicles, while a young driver appears to be in denial when he blows almost twice the drink drive limit at the roadside and asks officers to call his mum to prove he doesn't drink alcohol.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: A flood of patients with Covid-19 puts staff in the A&E department of Barnsley Hospital under pressure, with every arrival needing swabbing making waiting times even longer. Fifty-year-old Richard has been rushed in with severe burns across one side of his body, while 64-year-old Jan is in resus after his smart watch sounded the alarm when his heart rate dropped to a dangerously low level.

programme.title: 999: Emergency Call Out
programme.desc: Paramedic Ayshe and special sergeant Hannah respond to two calls - a car that has crashed into a wall and ended up on its roof and a heated argument in a convenience store.

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Damion has sustained numerous traumatic injuries after being trapped upside down in his car following a crash. Despite numerous injuries to the head and chest, Trauma Team Leader Dr Chris Pickering is most worried about Damion's lungs as his patient struggles to breathe.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: An experiment with a machine that can make duplicates of an object goes wrong and crew members are aghast to encounter their evil 'doppelgangers'.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Starbug crashes while trying to evade a giant squid, but instead of dying the crew members discover all their memories of their time on Red Dwarf had been generated by a video game - one they had been playing extremely badly. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn, with guest star Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Live at the Moth Club
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall comedy. When Phil Wang has an issue with a gig being filmed, Ellen has to find a solution, and George and resident techie Freddie jump at the chance to find a solution..

programme.desc: The team is joined by actor Brett Dier as they play games including Party Quirks, Duet, Dubbing, Scenes from a Hat, Living Scenery and Hoedown.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA
programme.desc: Emily Bett Rickards guests on the classic improv show, hosted by Aisha Tyler.

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: The Lazy Boys track down a rare and well-preserved Opel Kadett to turn into a rally car, but have to change their plans when the car arrives from Spain.

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Tim Glover finds a super rare two-door Toyota Carina as the Lazy Boys try to move into the Japanese retro car scene, but this time they may have bitten off more than they can chew.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The work of a team of mechanics who build bespoke cars for the Merseyside Police. Emergency surgery is needed when a brand-new prisoner van gets on the wrong side of a rooftop protestor. Boss Mick spends some time behind bars - all in the name of research, while the mounted unit needs help to get to the Liverpool-Everton derby.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. A Victoria operation targets the large-scale cannabis cultivation activities of a number of Vietnamese immigrants in the suburbs of Melbourne..

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police search for two men wanted in relation to a robbery and move in on a suspected drug dealer's house in the hope of finding evidence..

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a culinary journey by sea and land to explore the Far East's most diverse food cultures. He begins in Cambodia, where tourists are beginning to return after the fall of the Khmer Rouge regime. As well as discovering the joys of freshly caught swimmer crabs with green peppercorns, he learns how to cook the country's most famous dish - fish amok - and samples lok lak, made with marinated beef. He also visits the Angkor Wat temple and joins a rice barge to travel down the Mekong River.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling down the Mekong River to Vietnam, where the local diet features an abundance of herbs, freshwater fish and flavoursome soups. As well as following in the footsteps of his hero Graham Greene in Saigon, he is reunited with a former employee in Hanoi to try out the capital city's street food, and samples the produce on offer at the night-time stalls in Bangkok, Thailand.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police hunt for a man suspected of stealing rural machinery, rush to a derelict factory to seize firearms, and investigate a car accident..

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police execute a search warrant on a counterfeiting market stall and intervene to get an excessively low-riding car off the road for good..

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The workshop struggles to convert three quad bikes into frontline police vehicles, while an officer has to crash a pursuit car to protect the public. Steve wants to share his home-made birthday cake - if only he can persuade someone to eat it.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tries out the Lotus T125, which brings F1-style performance to the track, and an updated version of the classic Jensen Interceptor. Bob Geldof gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car, and the trio employ all manner of second-hand military equipment to knock down a row of derelict houses, aiming to complete the job in less time than a team of demolition experts.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May set out for the seaside in electric cars the Nissan Leaf and Peugeot iOn, stopping off in Lincoln along the way. Louis Walsh gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car, Richard Hammond meets an extraordinary rally team in which everyone, from mechanics to drivers, is an amputee with a military background, and the Lamborghini Aventador is taken out on the track.

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: From everyday heroes to Oz's top sportsmen and women, Australian athletes are all lining up to take their shot at the most difficult obstacle course in the world.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.sub-title: Travel Man: 48 Hours in New York
programme.desc: Comedian Katherine Ryan joins host Richard Ayoade on a 48-hour ram raid of the Big Apple. The duo's packed-to-overflow schedule sees them scale tall buildings, grab some culture in museums large and small and even attempt to rollerblade. Experiences include trips to the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Rockefeller Centre, queuing at the hottest patisserie in Manhattan for a cronut, and enjoying a free ferry ride to the Statue of Liberty. There's even time for Richard to reach the point of meltdown.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns with the comedy game show. Doc Brown, Richard Osman, Jon Richardson, Katherine Ryan and Joe Wilkinson accept a potato-throwing challenge.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Four famous faces go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week, with comedians Nish Kumar and Al Murray, Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo and broadcaster Anneka Rice the first contestants. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the weekly scores are tallied resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday, when the victor chooses between a House of Games dartboard and a branded dressing gown.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and writer Roisin Conaty, footballer-turned-pundit Chris Kamara and comedian and actor Nish Kumar to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include bread at restaurants, downloading music and ex-partners.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains Lee Mack and David Mitchell return for another episode of previously unseen material from the hit comedy panel show. Among the participants setting out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves are Clare Balding, Liz Bonnin, Jo Brand, Asim Chaudhry, Victoria Coren Mitchell, Greg Davies, Simon Day, Greg James, Guz Khan, Gabby Logan, Chris McCausland, Stephen Merchant, Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Angela Scanlon, John Simm, Ranj Singh, Henning Wehn, Claudia Winkleman and Lucy Worsley.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Phill Jupitus, Cally Beaton and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an unconventional look at a potpourri of topics, while facing some impossible questions. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor and comedian David Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Janey Godley and broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles joining captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's headlines.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns with the comedy game show. Doc Brown, Richard Osman, Jon Richardson, Katherine Ryan and Joe Wilkinson accept a potato-throwing challenge.
