As well as following in the footsteps of his hero Graham Greene in Saigon, he is reunited with a former employee in Hanoi to try out the capital city's street food, and samples the produce on offer at the night-time stalls in Bangkok, Thailand.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police hunt for a man suspected of stealing rural machinery, rush to a derelict factory to seize firearms, and investigate a car accident..

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police execute a search warrant on a counterfeiting market stall and intervene to get an excessively low-riding car off the road for good..

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The workshop struggles to convert three quad bikes into frontline police vehicles, while an officer has to crash a pursuit car to protect the public. Steve wants to share his home-made birthday cake - if only he can persuade someone to eat it.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tries out the Lotus T125, which brings F1-style performance to the track, and an updated version of the classic Jensen Interceptor. Bob Geldof gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car, and the trio employ all manner of second-hand military equipment to knock down a row of derelict houses, aiming to complete the job in less time than a team of demolition experts.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May set out for the seaside in electric cars the Nissan Leaf and Peugeot iOn, stopping off in Lincoln along the way. Louis Walsh gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car, Richard Hammond meets an extraordinary rally team in which everyone, from mechanics to drivers, is an amputee with a military background, and the Lamborghini Aventador is taken out on the track.

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: From everyday heroes to Oz's top sportsmen and women, Australian athletes are all lining up to take their shot at the most difficult obstacle course in the world.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.sub-title: Travel Man: 48 Hours in New York
programme.desc: Comedian Katherine Ryan joins host Richard Ayoade on a 48-hour ram raid of the Big Apple. The duo's packed-to-overflow schedule sees them scale tall buildings, grab some culture in museums large and small and even attempt to rollerblade. Experiences include trips to the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Rockefeller Centre, queuing at the hottest patisserie in Manhattan for a cronut, and enjoying a free ferry ride to the Statue of Liberty. There's even time for Richard to reach the point of meltdown.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns with the comedy game show. Doc Brown, Richard Osman, Jon Richardson, Katherine Ryan and Joe Wilkinson accept a potato-throwing challenge.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Four famous faces go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week, with comedians Nish Kumar and Al Murray, Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo and broadcaster Anneka Rice the first contestants. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the weekly scores are tallied resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday, when the victor chooses between a House of Games dartboard and a branded dressing gown.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and writer Roisin Conaty, footballer-turned-pundit Chris Kamara and comedian and actor Nish Kumar to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include bread at restaurants, downloading music and ex-partners.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains Lee Mack and David Mitchell return for another episode of previously unseen material from the hit comedy panel show. Among the participants setting out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves are Clare Balding, Liz Bonnin, Jo Brand, Asim Chaudhry, Victoria Coren Mitchell, Greg Davies, Simon Day, Greg James, Guz Khan, Gabby Logan, Chris McCausland, Stephen Merchant, Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Angela Scanlon, John Simm, Ranj Singh, Henning Wehn, Claudia Winkleman and Lucy Worsley.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Phill Jupitus, Cally Beaton and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an unconventional look at a potpourri of topics, while facing some impossible questions. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor and comedian David Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Janey Godley and broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles joining captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's headlines.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns with the comedy game show. Doc Brown, Richard Osman, Jon Richardson, Katherine Ryan and Joe Wilkinson accept a potato-throwing challenge.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Phill Jupitus, Cally Beaton and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an unconventional look at a potpourri of topics, while facing some impossible questions. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer finally tires of being embarrassed by his fellow crewmen, and decides to take his revenge by forcing them to spend 12 weeks in strict quarantine after they are exposed to a deadly virus. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie. Originally broadcast in 1992.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: An experiment with a machine that can make duplicates of an object goes wrong and crew members are aghast to encounter their evil 'doppelgangers'.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Starbug crashes while trying to evade a giant squid, but instead of dying the crew members discover all their memories of their time on Red Dwarf had been generated by a video game - one they had been playing extremely badly. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn, with guest star Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Live at the Moth Club
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall comedy. When Phil Wang has an issue with a gig being filmed, Ellen has to find a solution, and George and resident techie Freddie jump at the chance to find a solution..

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA
programme.desc: The team is joined by actor Brett Dier as they play games including Party Quirks, Duet, Dubbing, Scenes from a Hat, Living Scenery and Hoedown.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA
programme.desc: Emily Bett Rickards guests on the classic improv show, hosted by Aisha Tyler.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: The Lazy Boys track down a rare and well-preserved Opel Kadett to turn into a rally car, but have to change their plans when the car arrives from Spain.

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Tim Glover finds a super rare two-door Toyota Carina as the Lazy Boys try to move into the Japanese retro car scene, but this time they may have bitten off more than they can chew.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The work of a team of mechanics who build bespoke cars for the Merseyside Police. Emergency surgery is needed when a brand-new prisoner van gets on the wrong side of a rooftop protestor. Boss Mick spends some time behind bars - all in the name of research, while the mounted unit needs help to get to the Liverpool-Everton derby.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. A Victoria operation targets the large-scale cannabis cultivation activities of a number of Vietnamese immigrants in the suburbs of Melbourne..

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police search for two men wanted in relation to a robbery and move in on a suspected drug dealer's house in the hope of finding evidence..

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a culinary journey by sea and land to explore the Far East's most diverse food cultures. He begins in Cambodia, where tourists are beginning to return after the fall of the Khmer Rouge regime. As well as discovering the joys of freshly caught swimmer crabs with green peppercorns, he learns how to cook the country's most famous dish - fish amok - and samples lok lak, made with marinated beef. He also visits the Angkor Wat temple and joins a rice barge to travel down the Mekong River.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor and comedian David Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Janey Godley and broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles joining captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's headlines.

programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: Drama from the pen of Sally Wainwright. Catherine Cawood is the sergeant on duty when accountant Kevin Weatherill enters her police station to report a crime - the kidnapping of his boss's daughter. Although he originally came up with the plan as a way of paying for his children's private education, he eventually backed out. However, his partner is dangerous local drug kingpin Ashley Cowgill - and he has gone ahead with the plot anyway. The case hits a nerve for Catherine, who has lost her own daughter and is determined to bring the captors to justice. Sarah Lancashire stars, with Steve Pemberton, Joe Armstrong, James Norton, Siobhan Finneran and George Costigan.

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.desc: After the death of Ludovico's wife, Leonardo is given a new art commission. Testing his creativity and trialling a new technique, he must also deal with political unrest.

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.desc: Returning to Florence, an uninspired Leonardo accepts to paint the portrait of Lisa Gherardini, that will become the Mona Lisa.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe has his hands full again, with Fisher breathing down his neck over an operation to seize stolen vehicles, and a fussy food inspector causing a stir at the restaurant. Crime drama, guest starring Phyllis Logan, with Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the first of two episodes tonight, Chandler tries to maintain an outward veneer of respectability by marrying Debbie McAllister, but reckons without the persistence of a vengeful Mickey Webb, who continues working behind the scenes to end his career. Drummond and Hunter pose as decorators to carry out a surveillance operation, and profiler David Chiu arrives at Sun Hill to help with the serial killer investigation - much to the dismay of acting DI Sam Nixon, who already has a suspect in her sights.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As Dominic tries to give Isaac's father the best treatment possible, Lofty is desperate to repair their relationship, while Ange turns to Carole in order to protect her son. When an old patient of Jac's shows up with a tempting offer, she has to decide how far she will go for personal gain.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Eddie realises Alicia is scared of him after discovering that she has swapped all her shifts to avoid him. Meanwhile, Bea receives a phone call about her dad and leaves work to pick him up from the police station, and Sam and Jacob discuss which of the ED staff she would be able to beat in a boxing match.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: What should have been the happiest moment of Debbie McAllister's life turns into a hideous nightmare when Chandler lets his mask slip, raping her on their wedding night. However, his time is rapidly running out as the Criminal Investigations Bureau start probing his career, and in desperation he acquires a firearm under false pretences and absconds with his pregnant wife - can Meadows and Webb track them down before events reach a tragic conclusion?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil, thrown into a panic as reality sinks in, threatens Jamie. Meanwhile, Gus puts on a brave face. Will Sonia ever know what he had planned?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Little Mo has bad news for Peggy, who is starting to crack.

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Maritime drama with the Howard family, starring Maurice Colbourne and Jan Harvey.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer is arrested on suspicion of armed robbery - and to make matters worse, the only way he can clear his name is by admitting he was with a charming ex-girlfriend at the time. He must decide whether to come clean and face a jealous Charlotte's wrath, or take the consequences of the charge. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: A freak storm disrupts village life, bringing down power lines and causing a string of accidents. Jack and Beth immediately rush out to do their bit, working round the clock to treat casualties, saving strangers as well as close friends injured in the general devastation. Amanda Burton and Kevin Whately star as the medics.

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon's life appears to be in danger, with a potential assassin apparently stalking the leisure centre. However, he is far more concerned with addressing the facility's falling attendance figures. Chris Barrie stars.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth forces Richard to participate in a trip to the countryside to look for Iron Age remains, but further cultural excursions are curtailed when Daisy and Onslow report that Rose is behaving in an outrageous fashion. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Getting Barry Higher in the World
programme.desc: A child's kite inspires Seymour to create his own giant version, and he tries to demonstrate to those around him how simple it is to make one. Michael Aldridge and Mike Grady star in Roy Clarke's long-running comedy.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Nora Batty invites Compo up to her bedroom, but it proves to be an entirely innocent invitation as she merely wishes him to remove a mangle and deliver it to a friend. However, the nature of the item creates all sorts of problems. Long-running comedy, starring Bill Owen and Kathy Staff.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a doorkeeper at the House of Lords is murdered, Lynley and Havers believe the victim's gambling debts must have been the motive. When a clerk also dies, evidence of a wider conspiracy involving stolen papers is uncovered. The detectives locate the missing documents, but realise they are being followed and must catch the killer before someone beats them to it.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ricky Hanson faces trial for attempted murder, and his lawyer sets about trying to discredit each member of the squad. However, Jack receives a welcome distraction when an old friend asks him to reinvestigate the death of a wealthy businessman, and he, Brian and Gerry spring into action. Guest starring David Troughton, with Amanda Redman, James Bolam, Alun Armstrong and Dennis Waterman.

programme.title: Cutting It
programme.desc: Drama set in a Manchester hairdressing salon. Husband-and-wife owners Allie and Gavin celebrate the 10th anniversary of their business, but when empty premises across the road are purchased by a mysterious beauty, Allie is forced to confront emotions she has kept hidden for 18 years. Amanda Holden and Sarah Parish star.

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: With his friend in peril and a young woman kidnapped by the relentless serial killer, can Luther protect the innocent while preventing Cornelius's violent revenge from consuming him? Who is Luther willing to save, and who can't he bear to lose? Crime drama, starring Idris Elba and Ruth Wilson.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will plans to celebrate his birthday with a grown-up dinner, but his friends face a dilemma when they discover the event clashes with a more popular party. They end up gatecrashing the rival gathering, only to find that Simon's French exchange student steals the limelight.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will tries to reinvent the boys' image by taking them clubbing around London, but Simon is unsure whether to go until Carli shows an interest in the outing. When the friends arrive in the West End, their efforts to appear cool are hampered by aggressive bouncers, a tramp and some angry bus passengers.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will is asked to help co-ordinate the school's Duke of Edinburgh award scheme, but instead of carrying out his duties, he turns the situation to his advantage and tries to flirt with a university student. Meanwhile, Simon faces problems when his parents separate. Simon Bird and Joe Thomas star.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will becomes stressed as the friends prepare for their exams - apart from Jay, who finds himself preoccupied. Simon makes progress with Carli by helping her revise, and they all reminisce about the events of the past year. Comedy, starring Simon Bird.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The gang goes on the infamous sociology and geography field trip to Swanage, during which Neil tries his hardest to avoid the advances of over-friendly teacher Mr Kennedy. Meanwhile, Will takes a shine to new girl Lauren - but she is only interested in Simon. Comedy, starring Simon Bird.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: A plea hearing prompts true feelings to rise to the surface, while things go from bad to worse for Romeo when he wrongly accuses his crush of sleeping with his best friend.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Starkville, Mississippi, to try to rescue the failing Hotel Chester. Despite having more than 40 years' experience in the business, owner David Mollendor is at a loss as to how to make his dream of owning his own hotel work, while his wife Sukie is struggling as its chef, tackling the role without any formal catering experience. Gordon discovers a family tragedy that explains why this couple have become trapped in their business and wrestling with debt.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a dog-friendly hotel in West Dover, Vermont, that is in urgent need of help. Owner Sandy MacDougall runs the Four Seasons Inn like a hostel, with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests. The acerbic chef aims to get the business back on track before Sandy loses everything, but wonders whether it would be kinder to simply put this dog-friendly hotel to sleep.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Assisted by Geoff, Erica and Valley Erica find a new band member to replace Lainey, but Barry convinces Geoff that the new musician is trying to steal Erica from him. Adam and Murray each plot to get out of going to Valentine's Day dinner with Beverly.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.sub-title: There Can Be Only One Highlander Club
programme.desc: Despite Beverly wanting the two boys to bond, Adam and Johnny Atkins compete for the head of the Highlander Club at school; Barry tries to ensure that the JTP doesn't fall out of touch after high school.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy has a date with a mystery man, so Sheldon asks Howard and Raj to help him find a new girlfriend online. When Amy is coy with the details about the guy she's dating, Penny and Bernadette decide to spy on them. Stephen Merchant guest stars.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy try hanging out as friends when they spend Thanksgiving together at the aquarium. Howard reluctantly agrees to volunteer at a soup kitchen with Bernadette, Raj and Emily. Meanwhile, Penny discovers that Leonard knows more about her than she thought.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mitch and Cam prepare to walk down the aisle, but are faced with a host of hitches before they tie the knot. Pepper is forced to bring the ceremony forward by four hours because of a spreading wildfire, while one of the grooms' tuxedos has been left at the dry cleaners.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Part two of two. With Mitch and Cam's big day beset by one disaster after another, Pepper is forced to find a new venue - only for the couple to be forced out once again. Their only option is to hold the ceremony at home - but then Sal, who supposed to be marrying them, is forced to leave. Will they ever get to say 'I do'? Elizabeth Banks guest stars.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta tries to make a deal with a suspect Diaz has just arrested in an attempt to catch a car thief he has been tracking for years. Boyle's colleagues set out to meet his every need when he returns to work after being shot in the line of duty, and Captain Holt struggles to find a home for two puppies.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Santiago's ongoing bet about who can make the most arrests comes to an embarrassing conclusion, while Boyle receives a medal following the shooting, but his pain medication loosens his tongue and he starts to reveal what he really thinks of his colleagues.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny hosts a Halloween costume party, which proves a worthy test for the boys' social skills. During the event, Leonard has a run-in with Penny's ex-boyfriend. Kaley Cuoco, Johnny Galecki and Simon Helberg star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is forced to take Howard's place in the boys' video-game night while he is otherwise engaged with one of her friends. Simon Helberg, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Howard face problems when they file for a patent for their infinite persistence gyroscope. Plus, Penny, Amy and Bernadette give Raj dating advice when Emily reaches out to him after their breakup. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is shocked at a revelation from Sheldon after she buys him a new laptop, while Raj sells out Leonard and Howard after they lie to their wives in order to attend an early screening of a movie. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Plans for a relaxed evening at Jay's turn out to be anything but when Claire is mad with her dad over his lack of gratitude for her holding the fort at work and Mitchell is busy scheming after receiving a gift he doesn't like. Meanwhile, Phil and Gloria stop off at her old salon and get scissor-happy when a stylist fails to show up.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys and Pritchetts head Down Under for a family holiday so Phil can fulfil his mother's wish that he should one day return to the country where he was conceived. Mitch and Cam meet up with an old friend who is now a big star, but neither of them can stand him, while Jay and Claire let work eat into their vacation time. Rhys Darby (Flight of the Conchords) guest stars.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta suspects a civic leader of money laundering, but his investigation is shut down by the police commissioner. Determined to crack the case, he enlists Santiago and Holt to help uncover more evidence - and risks suspension as a result. Boyle is devastated when Vivian ends their relationship, so his colleagues try to cheer him up.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta takes part in an undercover FBI operation that ends in a mass arrest. But when one of the mobsters escapes he enlists Boyle's help in tracking him down. Captain Holt tests the squad's patience with practice drills in which Sgt Jeffords plays different roles, while Gina pleads with Boyle to keep a secret. US cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang's preparations for Star Wars Day are interrupted by the news that Professor Proton has died. Leonard and Penny attend the funeral, where they talk about their rejected marriage proposals, but Sheldon has difficulty dealing with the death of his childhood hero - until a surprise visitor helps him cope with his grief. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with a guest appearance by Bob Newhart.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: An edition first shown in November 2021 in which the armchair critics share their opinions on The Graham Norton Show, Mary Berry: Love to Cook, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special, Celebrity Antiques Road Trip, Strictly Come Dancing, The Lakes with Simon Reeve, Sex Unzipped, and This Morning. Narrated by Craig Cash.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The gang goes on the infamous sociology and geography field trip to Swanage, during which Neil tries his hardest to avoid the advances of over-friendly teacher Mr Kennedy. Meanwhile, Will takes a shine to new girl Lauren - but she is only interested in Simon. Comedy, starring Simon Bird.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will is unhappy about being forced by Mr Gilbert to take a work experience job at a garage due to a mix-up that sees Neil joining a newspaper. Meanwhile, Jay sorts out a placement for himself and Simon at his father's plant hire company. Starring Simon Bird and Blake Harrison.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will plans to celebrate his birthday with a grown-up dinner, but his friends face a dilemma when they discover the event clashes with a more popular party. They end up gatecrashing the rival gathering, only to find that Simon's French exchange student steals the limelight.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will tries to reinvent the boys' image by taking them clubbing around London, but Simon is unsure whether to go until Carli shows an interest in the outing. When the friends arrive in the West End, their efforts to appear cool are hampered by aggressive bouncers, a tramp and some angry bus passengers.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will is asked to help co-ordinate the school's Duke of Edinburgh award scheme, but instead of carrying out his duties, he turns the situation to his advantage and tries to flirt with a university student. Meanwhile, Simon faces problems when his parents separate. Simon Bird and Joe Thomas star.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will becomes stressed as the friends prepare for their exams - apart from Jay, who finds himself preoccupied. Simon makes progress with Carli by helping her revise, and they all reminisce about the events of the past year. Comedy, starring Simon Bird.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell

programme.title: Taskmaster

Alex Horne provides crucial data analytics.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the topical comedy panel show. Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined in their quest to uncover the public's most popular talking points by guests Jack Dee, Claudia Winkleman, Trevor Noah and Josh Widdicombe.

programme.title: Only the Biggest Hits
programme.desc: Turn up the volume on your TV! We're about to play only the biggest hits from some of your favourite music stars!.

programme.title: VOTW
programme.desc: Check out our Video Of The Week! This is Heaven, the brand new single from Niall Horan.

programme.title: Action! 20 On Screen Popstars
programme.desc: Lucy Jones guides you through a list of some of the biggest music stars who have also popped up on the silver screen! Gwen Stefani, Will Smith, J-Lo and Britney Spears all feature.

programme.title: Fresh Off the Boat
programme.desc: Eddie creates a diplomatic incident in Taiwan and is catapulted back to America. To cover his mistakes, Jessica agrees to temporary receive a Taiwanese girl.

programme.title: Fresh Off the Boat
programme.desc: While Jessica does not approve of Emery taking drama as an elective, Honey helps him prepare for a role anyway, leading to the two women arguing.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Phoebe and Paige try to find a way of returning a comatose Piper to consciousness, afraid she might be tricked into giving up her powers while delusional. Supernatural drama, starring Holly Marie Combs, Alyssa Milano and Rose McGowan.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Cole becomes the target of a widow seeking vengeance for her husband's murder, while Paige tells Piper and Leo they should test their readiness to become parents. Supernatural drama, starring Holly Marie Combs and Julian McMahon.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Bonnie thinks that Danny and Ben buying the bar is a bad idea and uses underhand tactics to sabotage their plans. Riley takes Tucker's damage lawsuit to court but finds out too late that the case is based on falsehoods. Comedy, starring Melissa Peterman and Jean-Luc Bilodeau.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: In a bid to sabotage Riley and Ross' blossoming relationship, Ben urges her kindhearted boyfriend to take part in a strenuous athletic competition. Bonnie is also in competitive mood because she wants to play poker with the boys - despite Tucker's strong opposition. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.

programme.title: Wife Swap USA
programme.desc: Two more couples from different backgrounds switch spouses - and sparks are set to fly this week as an animal conservationist swaps lives with a hunter who runs a shooting preserve.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter Seal goes undercover, disguised as a sales executive, to find talented musicians struggling to make it in the music industry.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Gold-medal gymnast Gabby Douglas pretends to be an office worker who wants to open her own gym - but her real task is to surprise up-and-coming gymnasts and inspiring coaches.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Flamangos restaurant in Whitehouse, New Jersey, where he tries to help the mother-and-daughter owners turn around their struggling business's fortunes. He faces a struggle because parent Adelle has a bad relationship with her staff and is disappointed by the resident chef, leaving Gordon with the added challenge of changing her attitude.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay gives his advice to Paul Bazzini, an award-winning chef from New York who now owns a restaurant in Ridgewood, New Jersey. Paul confesses he has lost his passion for food and is struggling to keep up with the business, a situation that seems evident to other members of staff, his wife and customers.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben takes Emma to his old doctor for a check-up and admits he hasn't had a medical for years. When the physician insists Ben has an examination and finds something of concern, Ben has a panic attack about his future and worries about who will take care of Emma if he's no longer around. Bonnie has lunch with Brad, having mistaken him for his twin brother Tad. Comedy, with Jean-Luc Bilodeau.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Riley realises that she hasn't met any of Ross's friends and decides to throw a cocktail party so she can get acquainted with them. Danny is worried that he knows nothing about his new girlfriend Ashley and goes to great lengths to find out her last name. Bonnie has some serious explaining to do when a valuable item goes missing. Eddie Cibrian guest stars.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Polly cannot choose between Abe or Craig, and decides to date them both, while Malcolm refuses to believe in the power of Dewey's supposedly lucky shirt. Elsewhere, the ranch hands make fun of Francis, and Lois takes the kids to a baseball convention.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Reese inadvertently completes Malcolm's science experiment, but has no idea how he did it. Meanwhile, Dewey comes up with a novel way of selling chocolate bars to raise money for the school. Family comedy, starring Frankie Muniz, Justin Berfield, Erik Per Sullivan and Bryan Cranston, who also directs.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's friends all fall for his sexy twin sister, who is paying him a visit, but he declares he will have the final say on who can date her - an announcement that particularly dismays Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny finds out Leonard's family never celebrated his birthdays, so she enlists Sheldon's help to organise a surprise party, while Howard gets him out of the way by staging an emergency hospital visit. Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki star.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

Hosted by Jimmy Carr.

Their only option is to hold the ceremony at home - but then Sal, who supposed to be marrying them, is forced to leave. Will they ever get to say 'I do'? Elizabeth Banks guest stars.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta tries to make a deal with a suspect Diaz has just arrested in an attempt to catch a car thief he has been tracking for years. Boyle's colleagues set out to meet his every need when he returns to work after being shot in the line of duty, and Captain Holt struggles to find a home for two puppies.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Santiago's ongoing bet about who can make the most arrests comes to an embarrassing conclusion, while Boyle receives a medal following the shooting, but his pain medication loosens his tongue and he starts to reveal what he really thinks of his colleagues.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny hosts a Halloween costume party, which proves a worthy test for the boys' social skills. During the event, Leonard has a run-in with Penny's ex-boyfriend. Kaley Cuoco, Johnny Galecki and Simon Helberg star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is forced to take Howard's place in the boys' video-game night while he is otherwise engaged with one of her friends. Simon Helberg, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Howard face problems when they file for a patent for their infinite persistence gyroscope. Plus, Penny, Amy and Bernadette give Raj dating advice when Emily reaches out to him after their breakup. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is shocked at a revelation from Sheldon after she buys him a new laptop, while Raj sells out Leonard and Howard after they lie to their wives in order to attend an early screening of a movie. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Plans for a relaxed evening at Jay's turn out to be anything but when Claire is mad with her dad over his lack of gratitude for her holding the fort at work and Mitchell is busy scheming after receiving a gift he doesn't like. Meanwhile, Phil and Gloria stop off at her old salon and get scissor-happy when a stylist fails to show up.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys and Pritchetts head Down Under for a family holiday so Phil can fulfil his mother's wish that he should one day return to the country where he was conceived. Mitch and Cam meet up with an old friend who is now a big star, but neither of them can stand him, while Jay and Claire let work eat into their vacation time. Rhys Darby (Flight of the Conchords) guest stars.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta suspects a civic leader of money laundering, but his investigation is shut down by the police commissioner. Determined to crack the case, he enlists Santiago and Holt to help uncover more evidence - and risks suspension as a result. Boyle is devastated when Vivian ends their relationship, so his colleagues try to cheer him up.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta takes part in an undercover FBI operation that ends in a mass arrest. But when one of the mobsters escapes he enlists Boyle's help in tracking him down. Captain Holt tests the squad's patience with practice drills in which Sgt Jeffords plays different roles, while Gina pleads with Boyle to keep a secret. US cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang's preparations for Star Wars Day are interrupted by the news that Professor Proton has died. Leonard and Penny attend the funeral, where they talk about their rejected marriage proposals, but Sheldon has difficulty dealing with the death of his childhood hero - until a surprise visitor helps him cope with his grief. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with a guest appearance by Bob Newhart.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Bob Newhart

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets fired from the movie, prompting her to take a serious look at her life. Raj receives advice from Sheldon after he sees Emily on a date with another man at the cinema, while Howard's mother breaks her leg. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny finds out Leonard's family never celebrated his birthdays, so she enlists Sheldon's help to organise a surprise party, while Howard gets him out of the way by staging an emergency hospital visit. Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Following the break-up of Penny's relationship, Leonard finally summons up the courage to ask her out. When she accepts, they both turn to Sheldon for advice on how to handle the forthcoming date. Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons star.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: The final two weddings take place, with 41-year-old single mum Melissa being partnered with Disney-loving dad-of-two Josh, and Melinda matched with fellow business mogul Layton.

programme.title: Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins USA
programme.desc: Maximum pressure is applied to the celebrities, who face a sky-scraping tactical challenge and an unrelenting simulation.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, focusing their attentions on Sitting on a Fortune, Close to Me, You, Nadiya's Fast Flavours, Animal, UFO Witness, This Morning's Spin to Win feature and the ITV News. Narrated by Craig Cash.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: An edition first shown in November 2021 in which the armchair critics share their opinions on The Graham Norton Show, Mary Berry: Love to Cook, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special, Celebrity Antiques Road Trip, Strictly Come Dancing, The Lakes with Simon Reeve, Sex Unzipped, and This Morning. Narrated by Craig Cash.

programme.title: Carol (2015)
programme.desc: A housewife trapped in a loveless marriage in 1950s New York forms a close attachment with a younger woman seeking fulfilment in her own life. A passionate secret affair develops, but as her husband grows suspicious, she finds her competence as a parent being called into question. Romantic drama based on Patricia Highsmith's novel The Price of Salt, starring Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara.

programme.title: The Duel at Silver Creek (1952)
programme.desc: A gambler goes after the gang of claim jumpers who killed his father, and joins forces with an injured marshal who also wants the criminals brought to justice. However, their partnership is tested when a devious femme fatale enters their lives. Don Siegel's Western, starring Audie Murphy, Stephen McNally and Faith Domergue.

programme.title: To Hell and Back (1955)
programme.desc: Biopic of actor Audie Murphy, following his service in the Second World War. Enlisting in the Army as a teenager to support his younger siblings, he excelled himself in action in the conflict in Europe and became one of America's most decorated soldiers. Starring Murphy as himself alongside Marshall Thompson, Charles Drake and Gregg Palmer.

credits.actor: Murphy as himself alongside Marshall Thompson

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass (1967)
programme.desc: A cavalry captain sets out to deliver a shipment of rifles to a fort besieged by marauding Apaches, but the mission is undermined by a villainous corporal who plans to steal the weapons and sell them to the enemy. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Michael Burns, Laraine Stephens, Kenneth Tobey and Michael Keep.

programme.title: Winchester '73 (1950)
programme.desc: A gunslinger tracks down his father's killer, but is unable to exact his revenge because the sheriff of the town makes a point of confiscating all firearms. Instead he challenges him to compete in a shooting competition to win a superb rifle, but when the murderer loses, he steals the coveted prize. Western, starring James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea and Stephen McNally.

programme.title: Charlotte Gray (2001)
programme.desc: An unassuming woman agrees to spy for the British during the Second World War and infiltrates occupied France, while embarking on a quest to locate her pilot lover, who has been shot down. Drama adapted from Sebastian Faulks' novel, starring Cate Blanchett, Billy Crudup, Rupert Penry-Jones and Michael Gambon.

programme.title: Bandits (2001)
programme.desc: Two convicts escape from prison and embark on a high-profile bank-robbing spree. A car crash leaves them with an extra accomplice - a bored housewife yearning for adventure, but before long her presence begins to disrupt their criminal enterprise and friendship, as well as their plans to retire to Mexico. Crime comedy, starring Bruce Willis, Billy Bob Thornton and Cate Blanchett. Directed by Barry Levinson.

programme.title: Elizabeth (1998)
programme.desc: Elizabeth I rises to the throne of a divided and troubled Britain, and the early years of her reign find her under pressure to marry and produce an heir - while enemies both overseas and within her own court plot to bring about her downfall. Shekhar Kapur's historical drama, starring Cate Blanchett, Geoffrey Rush, Christopher Eccleston and Joseph Fiennes.

programme.title: Vivarium (2019)
programme.desc: Young couple Gemma and Tom are keen to buy their first home together, but when they do, things take a strange turn. Sci-fi thriller starring Jesse Eisenberg and Imogen Poots.

programme.title: Carol (2015)
programme.desc: A housewife trapped in a loveless marriage in 1950s New York forms a close attachment with a younger woman seeking fulfilment in her own life. A passionate secret affair develops, but as her husband grows suspicious, she finds her competence as a parent being called into question. Romantic drama based on Patricia Highsmith's novel The Price of Salt, starring Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara.

programme.title: The Duel at Silver Creek (1952)
programme.desc: A gambler goes after the gang of claim jumpers who killed his father, and joins forces with an injured marshal who also wants the criminals brought to justice. However, their partnership is tested when a devious femme fatale enters their lives. Don Siegel's Western, starring Audie Murphy, Stephen McNally and Faith Domergue.

programme.title: To Hell and Back (1955)
programme.desc: Biopic of actor Audie Murphy, following his service in the Second World War. Enlisting in the Army as a teenager to support his younger siblings, he excelled himself in action in the conflict in Europe and became one of America's most decorated soldiers. Starring Murphy as himself alongside Marshall Thompson, Charles Drake and Gregg Palmer.

credits.actor: Murphy as himself alongside Marshall Thompson

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass (1967)
programme.desc: A cavalry captain sets out to deliver a shipment of rifles to a fort besieged by marauding Apaches, but the mission is undermined by a villainous corporal who plans to steal the weapons and sell them to the enemy. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Michael Burns, Laraine Stephens, Kenneth Tobey and Michael Keep.

programme.title: Winchester '73 (1950)
programme.desc: A gunslinger tracks down his father's killer, but is unable to exact his revenge because the sheriff of the town makes a point of confiscating all firearms. Instead he challenges him to compete in a shooting competition to win a superb rifle, but when the murderer loses, he steals the coveted prize. Western, starring James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea and Stephen McNally.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert travels to Mr B's Southern Kitchen in Florida, where he finds a failing restaurant that is tearing siblings Ninkia and Calvin apart.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy embarks on a culinary adventure in Alaska. He checks out a German food truck and a food-and-music restaurant that serves Cuban favourites.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to Burlington in Vermont to sample mac and cheese pancakes, and in Ottawa, Canada, he tries an unusual spaghetti pizza dish.

programme.title: Jamie Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Gennaro Contaldo head to Naples to seek out the family recipes the locals love to eat, discovering a street snack that is said to predate the modern pizza, before giving a foolproof guide to making the ultimate one at home. On the island of Procida, Jamie is blown away by sensational seafood dishes inspiring him to make a fish poached in 'crazy water'., while there are recipes for a classic margherita and sausage and broccoli pizza, as well as tuna, courgette and crushed almond spaghetti.

programme.title: Jamie Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Gennaro Contaldo head off the beaten track to the little-known region of Basilicata in search of old-school Italian recipes, meeting a family of shepherds who still cook as their ancestors did hundreds of years ago. Jamie gives a Sunday roast an Italian spin with his leg of lamb with herby stuffing and roast potatoes with sticky onions, before being put through his paces by an 89-year-old macaroni master and cooking up a simple spicy sausage and sweet pepper pasta.

programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Trisha's Southern Kitchen
programme.desc: After wrapping up a recording session at Allentown Studios, Trisha invites the crew over for a meal of barbecue peach pulled pork and cherry tomato mascarpone tartlets.

programme.title: Trisha's Southern Kitchen
programme.desc: Trisha and her sister teach girls at a non-profit organisation to make snack skewers. On the menu are chocolate chip banana muffins and baked apple chips.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: Stacking the Hay and Stocking the Freezer
programme.desc: While the family stacks hay, Ree Drummond stocks up the freezer with dishes including chicken enchiladas, pizza pockets, three cheese stuffed shells, and purple smoothie popsicles.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond spills the cocoa beans on her love for chocolate, including Ladd's chocolate pie, chocolate message cookies, chocolate fondue, and chocolate covered potato chips.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea makes her all-time favourite, cookbook-worthy recipes. She prepares delicious jerk chicken Rasta pasta and chocolate sandwich delights.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea takes on the challenge of making vegan soul food. She makes dishes like lemon-pepper fried 'chicken' tenders and vegan baked mac and cheese.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food, preparing smoked salmon with Yorkshire pudding, beets and asparagus, as well as cooking Greek chicken accompanied by sweet pepper and pea couscous with tzatziki.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a menu of grilled sardines with crispy halloumi, watercress salad and figs, and a chocolate mousse for dessert.

programme.title: Gok Wan's Easy Asian
programme.desc: Gok shares his recipes for feeding family and friends. On the menu is his versions of roast chicken and a Japanese sushi-rice classic.

programme.title: Gok Wan's Easy Asian
programme.desc: Gok prepares a delicious chicken wing recipe popular in the Philippines, and dumplings.

programme.title: Follow Donal to Europe
programme.desc: Food writer Donal Skehan discovers the best of Amsterdam's food revival, and goes fishing with a married couple before cooking their catch.

programme.title: Follow Donal to Europe
programme.desc: The food writer travels to Puglia, where he discovers homemade gelato, homemade burrata cheese, fresh fish at a colourful market, and street food with a big difference.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: From 2011, 12 enthusiastic home-cooks take part in a culinary contest devised by Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. In the first round, the competitors are challenged to make 24 decorated cupcakes in two hours, before being asked to bake a coffee and walnut Battenberg cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining bakers are given the task of creating a quiche that reflects their personalities, before tackling the technical challenge - tarte au citron. The pressure proves too much for some, as they try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The travelling chef ventures into Louisiana's state capital Baton Rouge to experience a unique American phenomenon - tailgating. It's the day of a big football match at Louisiana State University, and the LSU Tigers are playing in front of thousands of fans. Surrounded by people barbecuing, cooking and sharing food from the back of their pick-up trucks, James joins in and cooks up a storm ahead of the game. He also takes time out to visit a Baton Rouge-based oyster restaurant specialising in North American varieties.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food, preparing smoked salmon with Yorkshire pudding, beets and asparagus, as well as cooking Greek chicken accompanied by sweet pepper and pea couscous with tzatziki.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a menu of grilled sardines with crispy halloumi, watercress salad and figs, and a chocolate mousse for dessert.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea makes her all-time favourite, cookbook-worthy recipes. She prepares delicious jerk chicken Rasta pasta and chocolate sandwich delights.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea takes on the challenge of making vegan soul food. She makes dishes like lemon-pepper fried 'chicken' tenders and vegan baked mac and cheese.

programme.title: Be My Guest with Ina Garten
programme.desc: Ina Garten welcomes broadcaster Willie Geist to her home. She bakes salted chocolate chunk cookies, and they shake up bourbon sidecars with dried cherries.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares her favourite chocolate treats. She makes white chocolate pudding, Mississippi mud cake, chocolate mousse and chocolate-covered potato chips.

programme.title: Ainsley Eats The Streets
programme.desc: Ainsley arrives in Fes in Morocco ahead of the festival of Eid. He cooks chicken and lemon kebabs over coals in the streets, and makes a classic carrot and chickpea salad.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining six bakers have passed the halfway point of the contest, and now face three European bakes - beginning with yeast-leavened cakes, a tricky cross between cake and bread. Mary Berry then sets them the challenge of rustling up a Swedish princess torte, but they have their work cut out completing all 24 stages of the recipe in little more than two hours. They finish by creating their own version of the dobos torte, a multi-layered cake from Hungary. However, they must go one step further and bake a two-tiered version with an emphasis on caramel. Which of the bakers will come to a sticky end?.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads to Boston, where he goes on shopping spree in the public market ahead of cooking with local ingredients. He visits a restaurant where cocktails are often inhaled rather than drunk and finishes by taking a trip to Fenway Park baseball stadium to live out a boyhood dream.

programme.title: Michel Roux's Provence Masterclass
programme.desc: The acclaimed chef demonstrates how to prepare stunning dishes. He serves fish quenelles, chicken cooked in salt crust pastry and red wine poached pears.

programme.title: Ainsley Eats The Streets
programme.desc: Ainsley arrives in Fes in Morocco ahead of the festival of Eid. He cooks chicken and lemon kebabs over coals in the streets, and makes a classic carrot and chickpea salad.

programme.desc: Robert has 48 hours to rescue Big Tom's Backyard Grill and Bar in Cleveland, Tennessee. This failing restaurant is costing owners Tom and Sabrina their marriage.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: A property expert offers advice on buying a second home abroad.

programme.title: Fixer Upper Rewatch
programme.desc: Chip and Joanna describe the challenges of the unique home they renovated for a couple to make space for their growing family and thriving business.

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The two remaining designers compete for the last place in the quarter final, this time taking on the task of redesigning an iconic farmhouse kitchen. The pair have been given very different briefs, with one designer facing the challenge of painting over the dated wooden units. Although the decorative elements are well-received, the judges have concerns over the practical aspects of the design. The other contestant showcases their ingenuity with kitchen utensil light fittings, bespoke hooks and quirky accessories, but in doing so may have neglected the overall look of the French farm house brief. Presented by Tom Dyckhoff.

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: It's the quarter final and the four reamining contenders are in the village of Beer in Devon, with each taking on the transformation of a cosy sitting-room in a row of coastal cottages. Tom Dyckhoff explores the community, once known as a haven for smugglers, and uncovers its far reaching architectural influence, before Sophie Robinson, Daniel Hopwood and guest judge Oliver Heath decide which three go into the semi-final.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Building Off the Grid
programme.desc: Matteo Lundgren is taking the art of natural building to a whole new level with his custom-designed Cob houses that blend with the environment surrounding them, and are built solely from the Earth's ingredients.

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: Tom Dyckhoff presents a contest searching for untapped interior design talent, with experts Sophie Robinson and Daniel Hopwood acting as judges. The first heat sees oil-rig draughtsman Scott, college lecturer Fiona and young mother Francesca each take on a living room in a trio of neighbouring 17th-century Cotswolds cottages. The amateur enthusiasts are afforded three days, £1,000 and a small team of assistants to interpret and realise the homeowners' wishes.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Deon and Dave met in 2011 through the dating pages of a newspaper, and bonded over their shared love of the great outdoors and exploring different cultures. With a budget of £40,000, they're looking for somewhere bursting with Spanish character and charm and have Ben Hillman on hand to show them just how far their budget will stretch in the rural region of Jaen, Andalusia.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps an American expat couple with a generous £1million budget to search for a home in Surrey. Away from the house hunt, the presenter finds out about the county's motor racing history, and goes out on a track in a 1929 Bentley.

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: A woman from the Wirral looks to move back to Merseyside after living in rural Yorkshire for the last 20 years, with the lure of being close to her family calling her back home.

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home
programme.sub-title: Gone FIshin' for a Dream Home
programme.desc: After a $250,000 win, a couple are moving back to Louisiana. They want plenty of space for visitors with a fishing hole nearby.

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home
programme.desc: In North Carolina, David helps his youngest winner yet put her $390,000 prize towards buying a home to share with her mother and sister.

programme.title: Home Town
programme.desc: A Canadian couple with a budget of $140,000 search for a holiday home that will one day become their retirement retreat.

programme.desc: Following Christina Haack as she expands her design business in Tennessee.

programme.title: Prince of Darkness (1988)
programme.desc: A priest discovers a mysterious canister in the cellar of his small church, and asks a group of science students to investigate the curious object. It contains a strange matter that has a terrifying supernatural effect on all who come near it - and which proves to be the essence of evil. John Carpenter's horror, starring Donald Pleasence, Jameson Parker and Victor Wong.

programme.title: Resident Evil (2002)
programme.desc: A team of commandos enters a top-secret underground research facility when a deadly virus which turns victims into flesh-eating zombies is accidentally released. But their containment mission spins out of control as a rogue super-intelligent computer and hordes of the marauding undead wreak havoc. Sci-fi action horror, starring Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez and James Purefoy.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Alex is framed for the murder of her ex-partner and is thrown into a women's prison, so her father is recruited to help her cause.

programme.title: Mutant X
programme.desc: The team tries to prevent ruthless international terrorists from acquiring a lethal substance at an auction. Sci-fi drama, starring Victor Webster and Victoria Pratt.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Troi is forced to take over as captain after Picard becomes trapped in a lift following a collision between the Enterprise and a quantum filament. Meanwhile, Data loses his head and Worf finds himself acting as midwife to Keiko. Sci-fi drama, starring Marina Sirtis, Patrick Stewart and Michael Dorn.

programme.title: 10.5 Apocalypse
programme.desc: Part one of four. A series of natural disasters hits America. Seismologist Samantha Hill is enlisted to explain the sudden subterranean activity, causing floods, earthquakes and volcanos, and discovers a faultline heading for two of the country's biggest nuclear reactors. Facing an inevitable planetary meltdown she turns to her father, a retired scientist, for help. Disaster drama, starring Kim Delaney and Beau Bridges.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone

programme.title: Meteor Apocalypse (2010)
programme.desc: A gigantic meteor enters Earth's orbit and begins to disintegrate, raining space debris across the globe. Los Angeles is destined to be destroyed within three days, leaving one man in a race against time to find his wife and son before it is too late. Sci-fi thriller, starring Joe Lando, Claudia Christian, Cooper Harris, Brendan Bradley, Sueann Han and Gregory Paul Smith.

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: The crew is stranded on a hostile planet and find themselves stalked by a beautiful woman who can kill people just by touching them. Starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and DeForest Kelley.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Wesley Crusher returns to find the crew of the Enterprise addicted to a dangerous new game. Sci-fi adventure, starring Wil Wheaton and Patrick Stewart.

programme.title: Airwolf
programme.desc: Hawke and Santini smash a crooked masterplan to control the world's cash reserves. Action adventure, starring Jan-Michael Vincent and Ernest Borgnine.

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A rookie officer goes undercover as a drug dealer in an attempt to keep heroin out of schools, but his assignment becomes complicated when he meets an old friend.

programme.title: Seal Team VI: Journey into Darkness (2008)
programme.desc: Drama based on real events. When a team of Navy Seals discover that their mission in Iraq is compromised, they face harrowing consequences that change the course of the conflict..

programme.title: Lake Placid vs Anaconda (2015)
programme.desc: A lake becomes the setting for a battle for supremacy between giant mutated crocodiles and genetically engineered snakes. The local sheriff, who has battled the giant serpents before, joins forces with a game warden to prevent a group of female students from becoming the creatures' latest prey. Comedy horror, starring Corin Nemec, Yancy Butler and Robert Englund.
