programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists.

programme.title: Euphoria (2017)
programme.desc: When her sister Emilie reconnects, estranged artist Ines hopes they will spend some time building bridges while on a trip to what appears to be a luxury resort in the Swiss mountains. However, tensions quickly skyrocket when a dark secret is revealed. Director Lisa Langseth's drama, starring Alicia Vikander and Eva Green.

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes.

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures.

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world.

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times.

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times.

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home.

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Alien devices land on the lunar surface and emit oxygen, turning the moon into an atmosphere-rich world with blue skies and a warm sun. Unfortunately, the idyllic conditions prove short-lived. Starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain.

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: First-hand accounts of the disaster that befell United Airlines Flight 232, which was making its way from Denver to Chicago in 1989 when the DC-10 aircraft suffered a catastrophic failure to the tail-engine.

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen visit Winchester, where they tuck into bangers at a local pub and sushi at a Wasabi Farm. They also meet an artist who is farming water buffalo, are given bread and beer at the Hospital of St Cross, and Mason has a go at fly-fishing for the first time and catches a trout.

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: Exploring legends of London to get to the bottom of what's fact and what's fiction.

programme.title: Castle Builders
programme.desc: How castles changed from being siege-proof fortresses to places of ceremony and fantasy, with reference to the rebuilt Windsor Castle as a notable example.

programme.title: On the Fiddle (1961)
programme.desc: A Second World War black marketeer is arrested, but a judge forces him to join the army rather than sending him to prison. He soon finds a willing accomplice in an easy-going fellow recruit, and together they concoct a variety of underhanded schemes to avoid being sent to the front line. Comedy based on RF Delderfield's novel, starring Alfred Lynch and Sean Connery.

programme.title: Five Clues to Fortune (1957)
programme.desc: A group of children search for the treasure hidden in a monastery before the building is sold. Children's mystery, starring David Hemmings and John Rogers.

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels from Cardigan Bay to Liverpool, visiting the heritage railway in Tywyn that was the inspiration for Thomas the Tank Engine and a community that is famous for knitting. She also paints a carriage in Boston Lodge, catches the famous Ffestiniog railway through Snowdonia, and visits Europe's fastest zip wire and largest pet cemetery.

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering learns that the manager of his Paris shop is shipping illegal narcotics in the base of antiques he ships abroad.

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A stray cat wearing a cone-shaped collar turns out to be living a double life. A highly spirited cat called Charlie gets his annual check-up and a sphynx cat called Vader is treated for painful spots on his tummy.

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones.

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: Convicts Mick and Gary are being escorted to the dentist when their prison van has an accident and they wind up at a remote farmhouse with two sex starved sisters.

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring and revealing New Cross, Eltham, and Catford.

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion.

programme.title: My Day (2019)
programme.desc: A drug mule hopes to leave her life behind, but an encounter with a duplicitous client leaves her injured and in debt to her boss. To make up for the money that was stolen from her, she is forced to take on one last assignment. Crime drama, starring Hannah Laresa Smith and Mike Kinsey.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: It may be late but you can rely on Magic to keep you company all night long with nothing but our greatest hits.

programme.title: Brighten Up Your Breakfast!
programme.desc: Let us brighten up your morning with some of our favourite feel-good songs!.

programme.title: Top 10 at 10: 2010
programme.desc: It's throwback time! We're bringing you 10 of the biggest pop hits from our 2010 archive.

programme.title: Ultimate One Hit Wonders
programme.desc: How many of these One Hit Wonders will you remember? Stay tuned to find out...

programme.title: Magic Picks Of The Week
programme.desc: Join Eloise Carr for throwbacks, personal faves and legends in the Magic Picks of the Week.

programme.title: Don't Stop Moving: Pop Party
programme.desc: Don't stop movin' to the funky funky beat! We've got a playlist full of classic pop party tunes that are guaranteed to get you dancing.

programme.title: Top 10 at 10: 2002
programme.desc: It's throwback time! We're bringing you 10 of the biggest pop hits from our 2002 archive.

programme.title: Mellow Magic!
programme.desc: Full to the brim with all your favourite feelgood and relaxing songs of all time - it can only be the dreamy Mellow Magic.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Surgeons must plan their next move carefully when Daisy, a 22-month-old girl, arrives at St George's Hospital by air ambulance after being kicked in the head by a horse at her family's stables. Meanwhile, 54-year-old Mike, who has a form of medication-resistant epilepsy, arrives in minors with a bandage around his jaw after falling face-first onto the pavement. Plus, 100-year-old Florence, who was diagnosed with dementia three years earlier, and her daughter Frances arrive at the hospital when the former suffers what appears to be a stroke.

programme.title: 24 Hour Baby Hospital
programme.desc: Michelle and Clive return to the Rotunda three years after the birth of their first child Zach, who passed away in the hospital after being born prematurely. They are hoping they can avoid early labour again and for the safe arrival of their second child. Elsewhere, Leonie and Dan anticipate the arrival of their twins, and Sara and Vishnu prepare to welcome their first child.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A 12-year-old suffers a broken thigh bone after a motorcycle collision in Oxfordshire, while a paraglider is treated for multiple injuries after a crash on the Cumbrian coast.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty finds out that shellfish consumed by millions have been feeding on plastic discarded in the sea, with shocking global implications. Kate Quilton finds out whether the makers of Marmite can really predict whether people will love or hate their distinctive yeast-based spread, as claimed in their latest TV advert, and Tebbutt aims to solve the age-old mystery of how to smoothly extract ketchup from a bottle - by running across a pond of custard.

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Dorothy Pinkett wants a bolthole where she can escape to on her favourite island of Menorca. For the past seven years she has been caring for her husband, who is disabled after having a stroke. Owning a holiday home that can provide some respite for herself and his wonderful team of carers is really important, so the pressure is really on for Jasmine Harman to deliver the perfect property for her budget of £135,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple launch a luxury B&B in France with a toddler in tow, while a microbrewery in Murcia aims to crack the Spanish lager market.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items in Gloucestershire, including a rare pre-Second World War exercise bike and a huge set of farmyard scales used to weigh potatoes.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Brighton to meet recycler Cat, who has tons of junk in a series of sea containers. Henry salvages a children's scooter, while Simon constructs the largest corkscrew that valuer Ronnie has ever seen.

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Probate detectives discover a surprise connection to gun-making in Birmingham, while searching for the beneficiaries to a £100,000 estate. The case of a west London man with Indian ancestry, proves a major challenge for the team.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Unicorn Inn in Ludlow, Shropshire, where husband and wife team Lee and Zoe Osbourne hope their glamorous fairy-tale style rooms will impress.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the East Walls Hotel in Chichester, West Sussex, owned by history-loving husband and wife Celia and Damon Haughey, who have rejected the boutique label.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Wheatsheaf in Sandbach, Cheshire, where owner Jake Pare and general manager Chris Baldwin hope to impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay of the week is at the Shawries Hotel in Blackpool, where the dated decor takes two guests back to their childhood and breakfast is a build-your-own sandwich platter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. East Walls Hotel is first up, and owners Celia and Damon need to clean up Dave's toilet brush troubles before broaching his beef with the breakfast banger.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting in the Kentish countryside. Kirstie helps doting father Charlie, who is recently divorced, and his two children find a new family home as they start a new chapter in their lives. Elsewhere, Phil meets Ella and Grant, a couple who are longing for their own space as they want to start a family.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet a couple in Rushden in Northamptonshire who are unsure whether they should renovate their current home or sell up and move into another. Susan and John are torn over their unique five-bed character home, so Kirstie and Phil offer their expert advice in an effort to help them make the right decision for their family's future.

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: The wooden double front door with its delicate metal tracery, the metal awnings over the windows, and the stone balustrade edging the front steps, are all in a state of disrepair. Angel's father, a former jeweller, steps in to try and make a copy of the huge 150-year-old key to the front door. The family goes to the beach to collect razor clams.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets designers Beth Dadswell and Andrew Wilbourne, who have rescued a crumbling Victorian dairy in south-east London and plan to convert it into a family home, while retaining as much of the ramshackle roof, rust and crumbling brickwork as possible on a budget of £260,000. However, as they begin stripping back the old building, the true extent of its condition becomes plain, and the couple have to decide quite how much decay they are willing to live with.

programme.title: Jonathan Ross' Myths and Legends
programme.desc: Jonathan travels around the UK on the hunt for incredible tales. He starts his journey in Whitby, where he discovers what inspired the creation of Dracula. He also journeys up the coast to learn about the Hobs - mythical cave-dwelling creatures with healing powers - before heading inland to Knaresborough to visit Mother Shipton's Cave.

programme.title: Chernobyl: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Using previously classified KGB documents, the second part of this film explores how far Soviet leaders were willing to go to cover up the Chernobyl disaster, including exposing children to toxic fallout at the Kyiv May Day parade to prove to the world that all was fine. Featuring first-hand accounts from those who survived the blast, including Oleksiy Ananenko, who braved radioactive waters to prevent a deadlier second explosion and Maryna Sivets, whose unborn child's life was put at risk.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-one-year-old Cyril is airlifted to hospital after a car crash which required him to be cut from his car. Meanwhile, the medical team treat 57-year-old Caroline, who arrives at St George's with chest pains, plus five-year-old Roman has a pencil stuck in his ear.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Sunderland, medics must work quickly to try and save a woman's life following a major gas explosion. A boating accident on the Norfolk Broads leaves holidaymaker Carol with a partially amputated foot. Plus, a man suffers multiple serious injuries when he comes off his motorbike.

programme.desc: Dorothy Pinkett wants a bolthole where she can escape to on her favourite island of Menorca. Owning a holiday home that can provide some respite for herself and his wonderful team of carers is really important, so the pressure is really on for Jasmine Harman to deliver the perfect property for her budget of £135,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple launch a luxury B&B in France with a toddler in tow, while a microbrewery in Murcia aims to crack the Spanish lager market.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items in Gloucestershire, including a rare pre-Second World War exercise bike and a huge set of farmyard scales used to weigh potatoes.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Brighton to meet recycler Cat, who has tons of junk in a series of sea containers. Henry salvages a children's scooter, while Simon constructs the largest corkscrew that valuer Ronnie has ever seen.

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Probate detectives discover a surprise connection to gun-making in Birmingham, while searching for the beneficiaries to a £100,000 estate. The case of a west London man with Indian ancestry, proves a major challenge for the team.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Unicorn Inn in Ludlow, Shropshire, where husband and wife team Lee and Zoe Osbourne hope their glamorous fairy-tale style rooms will impress.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the East Walls Hotel in Chichester, West Sussex, owned by history-loving husband and wife Celia and Damon Haughey, who have rejected the boutique label.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Wheatsheaf in Sandbach, Cheshire, where owner Jake Pare and general manager Chris Baldwin hope to impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay of the week is at the Shawries Hotel in Blackpool, where the dated decor takes two guests back to their childhood and breakfast is a build-your-own sandwich platter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. East Walls Hotel is first up, and owners Celia and Damon need to clean up Dave's toilet brush troubles before broaching his beef with the breakfast banger.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting in the Kentish countryside. Kirstie helps doting father Charlie, who is recently divorced, and his two children find a new family home as they start a new chapter in their lives. Elsewhere, Phil meets Ella and Grant, a couple who are longing for their own space as they want to start a family.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet a couple in Rushden in Northamptonshire who are unsure whether they should renovate their current home or sell up and move into another. Susan and John are torn over their unique five-bed character home, so Kirstie and Phil offer their expert advice in an effort to help them make the right decision for their family's future.

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: The wooden double front door with its delicate metal tracery, the metal awnings over the windows, and the stone balustrade edging the front steps, are all in a state of disrepair. Angel's father, a former jeweller, steps in to try and make a copy of the huge 150-year-old key to the front door. The family goes to the beach to collect razor clams.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets designers Beth Dadswell and Andrew Wilbourne, who have rescued a crumbling Victorian dairy in south-east London and plan to convert it into a family home, while retaining as much of the ramshackle roof, rust and crumbling brickwork as possible on a budget of £260,000. However, as they begin stripping back the old building, the true extent of its condition becomes plain, and the couple have to decide quite how much decay they are willing to live with.

programme.title: Jonathan Ross' Myths and Legends
programme.desc: Jonathan travels around the UK on the hunt for incredible tales. He starts his journey in Whitby, where he discovers what inspired the creation of Dracula. He also journeys up the coast to learn about the Hobs - mythical cave-dwelling creatures with healing powers - before heading inland to Knaresborough to visit Mother Shipton's Cave.

programme.title: Chernobyl: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Using previously classified KGB documents, the second part of this film explores how far Soviet leaders were willing to go to cover up the Chernobyl disaster, including exposing children to toxic fallout at the Kyiv May Day parade to prove to the world that all was fine. Featuring first-hand accounts from those who survived the blast, including Oleksiy Ananenko, who braved radioactive waters to prevent a deadlier second explosion and Maryna Sivets, whose unborn child's life was put at risk.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Surgeons must plan their next move carefully when Daisy, a 22-month-old girl, arrives at St George's Hospital by air ambulance after being kicked in the head by a horse at her family's stables. Meanwhile, 54-year-old Mike, who has a form of medication-resistant epilepsy, arrives in minors with a bandage around his jaw after falling face-first onto the pavement. Plus, 100-year-old Florence, who was diagnosed with dementia three years earlier, and her daughter Frances arrive at the hospital when the former suffers what appears to be a stroke.

programme.title: 24 Hour Baby Hospital
programme.desc: Michelle and Clive return to the Rotunda three years after the birth of their first child Zach, who passed away in the hospital after being born prematurely. They are hoping they can avoid early labour again and for the safe arrival of their second child. Elsewhere, Leonie and Dan anticipate the arrival of their twins, and Sara and Vishnu prepare to welcome their first child.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A 12-year-old suffers a broken thigh bone after a motorcycle collision in Oxfordshire, while a paraglider is treated for multiple injuries after a crash on the Cumbrian coast.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty finds out that shellfish consumed by millions have been feeding on plastic discarded in the sea, with shocking global implications. Kate Quilton finds out whether the makers of Marmite can really predict whether people will love or hate their distinctive yeast-based spread, as claimed in their latest TV advert, and Tebbutt aims to solve the age-old mystery of how to smoothly extract ketchup from a bottle - by running across a pond of custard.

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Dorothy Pinkett wants a bolthole where she can escape to on her favourite island of Menorca. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-one-year-old Cyril is airlifted to hospital after a car crash which required him to be cut from his car. Meanwhile, the medical team treat 57-year-old Caroline, who arrives at St George's with chest pains, plus five-year-old Roman has a pencil stuck in his ear.

programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. Geoff Clark from Sunderland hopes that audio expert Mark Stuckey can restore a beloved 1960s jukebox, and horologist Steve Fletcher turns his attention to a 400-year-old wall clock that has laid broken in a box for years. Tim Gunn restores a stowaway bike to its former glory and silversmith Brenton West works on a lifeboat compass.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects. The green-fingered experts attempt to turn a boring lawn and crumbling patio into a Bollywood dream garden with an outdoor kitchen for Asif, Sabina and their family.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain looking for items to fix up and flog on behalf of their owners. In this episode they're close to the Malvern Hills. Henry picks two saddles from horse owner Sabrina and converts them into bar stools, while Simon makes a handsome profit on a 1960s kitchen cupboard.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard road trips to Cornwall for a major buying mission. In Penzance, he haggles with a hoarder who owns a reclamation yard, before heading to the county's busiest auction house.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: French polisher Alex is excited to work on a 100-year-old table. And, paper conservator Ashely has to take safety precautions to work on a mouldy poster..

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds an unregistered Cobra sports car that has only 1,000 miles on its clock, but expert mechanic Edd China faces a difficult challenge to get it to pass a tough emissions test.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Mahoneys look for gold in one of the world's most remote regions. Meanwhile, the Victorian Diggers may have stumbled across millions of dollars' worth of gold.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John head to salvage yard in Clacton-on-Sea, Essex, and unearth a quirky enamel advertising sign. Drew also manages to nab the deal of the century with a work of art in London.

programme.title: Opal Hunters: Red Dirt Road Trip
programme.desc: Rod and JC get a painful lesson while mining in the hot and hostile Andamooka. Then, they provide an urgently needed airdrop of supplies to flood-ravaged farmers..

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: Bad brakes, frazzled nerves and a rough road have Claudia doubting her crew can haul their huge bunkhouse to camp in one piece.

programme.title: Jade Fever

programme.title: How Do They Do It?

A look at the fortunes of the dynasty of Ivarr, whose grandsons spent 15 years in exile after being driven out of Dublin before returning to Ireland in 917 and laying out the urban area that grew into the capital city. Dr Pat Wallace, who led the excavations of the Viking city of Dublin, and other experts reveal how the Vikings had a huge amount of wealth and material possessions, thanks to trade that stretched as far as the Middle East.

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Rotherham housemates Craig and Steve, married couple Angela and Mike from Bridgend, and sisters Laura and Mollie from Leeds use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Hosted by Adil Ray.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Darren, Rebecca, Carole and Russell pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Spitfire: The Birth of a Legend
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the single-seater fighter plane, from its design to its vital role in the Second World War, with contributions by former pilots.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Horticulturist and broadcaster Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France, beginning by examining the stories behind important historic ones and seeing how throughout history they have been used as a public expression of money, power and passion. Among those featured are elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress and then the wife of a king, magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that incited violent jealousy in another monarch and a modern-day chateau plot that came close to bankrupting its owner.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: The horticulturist examines how the national love of food has influenced gardens in France. He visits a number of 'potagers', in which vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays, and talks to gardeners about this style of planting, revealing how it has been copied the world over. He also spends time in allotments, learns to pick asparagus, enjoys some of the best produce from the land and explores the importance the French attach to the soil.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: The horticulturist examines the influence France's artistic tradition has had on the country's gardens. He visits examples created by painters Claude Monet and Paul Cezanne, as well as going to see several contemporary plots to witness how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Dave and Harry Rich are in Stamford, Lincolnshire, where they come up with ideas to transform a back garden for a family of seven.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich Brothers descend on a Kent garden in need of a makeover for a couple and their sons, with a cabin in a disused space being the focus of attention.

programme.title: Country House Rescue
programme.desc: Ruth Watson comes to the aid of Tim Le Grice, a solicitor struggling to keep Trereife House in Penzance, Cornwall, from succumbing to physical and financial ruin. She discovers the situation has not been helped by Tim's misguided business ventures, including a zoo and a dairy farm, but believes that his daughter Georgina may have come up with an idea that could give the ailing property a boost.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Comfort Food
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare dishes for when the temperature drops, such as oxtail soup with herby dumplings, a chestnut and mushroom pie and a new take on treacle sponge.

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: George Clarke revisits retired police officer Mark Rand and his wife Pat, who took on the restoration of the Grade II-listed water tower at Settle station in North Yorkshire. Two years after the project started, the architect wants to see if the couple have succeeded in transforming the tower into a suitable home. He also meets train enthusiast and former politician Michael Portillo, who was instrumental in saving the Settle to Carlisle line during his tenure as transport minister.

programme.title: Britain's Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the UK's past through the stories of its towns, examining key periods in history by delving into the secrets of places that encapsulate them. In the first episode, Alice tells the story of Roman Britain by studying the history of Chester. She enjoys an authentic Roman feast, heads deep underground to check out an extraordinary archaeological find, and explores a radical theory regarding the Romans' plans for Chester.

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: A couple in Essex with five daughters plan to build a contemporary home in a woodland clearing, but the budgets and schedules soon get out of control.

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Presenter Helen Skelton and expert garden designer Danny Clarke head to Bradford to breathe new life into a thoroughly overgrown garden lost in time. The aim is that they will get the job completed in just one day for owner Beverley and her family.

programme.title: You, Me, Garden?
programme.desc: Clara and the gardeners head to South Oxfordshire to help transform Elisabeth's run-down garden. Elisabeth is a physiotherapist who's in need of help reconnecting with nature.

programme.title: Wilderness Walks with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The bushcraft expert explores the Thames Path by canoe, travelling almost 200 miles as he follows the course of the river from its source near Kemble in Gloucestershire to the Thames Barrier at Charlton. Along the way, he takes in an array of wildlife including kingfishers and water voles, as well as setting up camp overnight in woodlands.

programme.desc: Two virgins, a 29-year-old woman and a 40-something man, take tentative steps toward intercourse when they commit to intensive sex therapy in the US.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave goes to Wales to bag a Sierra Cosworth, a sought-after car in the bidding market. Dad Derek gets his hands on a more sedate 1926 Standard Tourer - a quirky little motor.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Whistler on the Canadian Pacific seaboard, a remote mountain town whose creation was made possible with record-breaking engineering equipment, helping establish one of the best ski resorts in the world.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Nato's Airborne Warning and Control System, known as Awac, a cutting-edge aircraft with a huge radar dome mounted on its roof that enables pilots to spot hostile intrusion as they protect state borders of the countries in the Nato alliance. One of the most complex surveillance aircrafts in the world, it is able to seek out, locate, and defend against threats - no matter how fast moving or well hidden.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers
programme.desc: Salt water and iron don't mix and Southend Pier, built back in 1888, has seen better days. Now a team of specialists are working hard to prevent it falling into the sea.

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers
programme.desc: After 14 decades centre stage the Manchester Town Hall is in urgent need of repair. Now a dedicated team are working hard to do this architectural giant justice.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a decrepit Liberian landmark with American origins, a desolate town in Belgium and a pioneering scientific structure in Cleveland.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: A profile of Dudley Mason, who was awarded the George Cross after the tanker he was commanding came under attack during Operation Pedestal in August 1942 to relieve Malta.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Secrets of the London Underground
programme.desc: Tim Dunn and Siddy Holloway explore the disused parts of London Bridge, while Siddy visits Ongar in Essex and nearby Blake Hall.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Dudley in the West Midlands to Bridgnorth, Shropshire. He learns how Victorian blacksmithing was not for the faint-hearted, rides on one of Britain's most modern trains and traverses the Victoria Bridge at Bewdley in Worcestershire.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Welshpool, Powys, to Aberystwyth in Ceredigion. He experiences Victorian entertainment in one of Wales's best-loved resorts, hears how the railways took the country's textiles into the most exclusive households and unleashes the power of a 19th-century engineering triumph.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows in the footsteps of engineer Isambard Kingdom Brunel as he travels from London to Newton Abbot in Devon. He begins by taking a trip from Paddington station to Warminster in Wiltshire, along the way learning about a Victorian asylum, giving a historic horse a facelift and making malt the 19th-century way.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Salisbury in Wiltshire to Castle Cary, Somerset, visiting a world-famous tourist spot that has been captivating visitors since the Victorian era. He also takes to the air in Yeovil and tries his hand at clothmaking the 19th-century way.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

He begins by taking a trip from Paddington station to Warminster in Wiltshire, along the way learning about a Victorian asylum, giving a historic horse a facelift and making malt the 19th-century way.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Salisbury in Wiltshire to Castle Cary, Somerset, visiting a world-famous tourist spot that has been captivating visitors since the Victorian era. He also takes to the air in Yeovil and tries his hand at clothmaking the 19th-century way.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Secrets of the London Underground
programme.desc: Tim Dunn and Siddy Holloway explore the disused parts of London Bridge, while Siddy visits Ongar in Essex and nearby Blake Hall.

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World
programme.desc: For the first time in 50 years, the Airfix team attempt a 1:24 scale kit of a Spitfire. Will designer Chris be able to capture the iconic warbird in sufficient detail?.

programme.title: The Architecture the Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn discovers how railway architecture has been repurposed. He starts with Manchester's Castlefield area, where viaducts still dominate the cityscape.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a decrepit Liberian landmark with American origins, a desolate town in Belgium and a pioneering scientific structure in Cleveland.
